1.content:
Now in order to get really started, we must be able to choose which game we are going to focus on. A mixture option will be listed as well and readers are free to add other Fire Emblem games in the other options.

Remember, if you choose a game which does not have the characters you like...well too bad D:

Also note that in mixture story, the plot should involve somehow the characters coming together for a good reason.
1.title: A Hard Decision

11.content: So you have chosen the first North American release, Fire Emblem for the Gameboy Advance. Now pick your MAIN character. Whether the character is shrunk or grows will be decided later.
11.title: Fire Emblem (GBA) Character Selection

choices: Matthew Uses The Staff On Himself/Finds A Magic User
Matthew Sells The Staff To Another Member Of The Party
Matthew Shows Off The Staff To Other People
111.content:
Matthew grinned as he opened his box of stolen treasures. The new items in his collection were amazing. A golden bow he took from a lone archer in the woods. A impressive looking dagger from a merchant he had "visited" a few days ago. And there was his newest item. A strange wand he stole from the nearby church. It was listed as forbidden. Of course that just made Matthew have to have it.

The long slender stick was carved with figures and words that Matthew didn't understand. He doubted he could use it. It would be up to a sage or a priest/valkyrie to get this thing going.

But that didn't mean the staff wasn't valuable, and Matthew would most definitely make a pretty hefty amount selling it, perhaps even to someone in the party. Matthew bet a lot of people would want this rare item. Of course he would not say it was stolen - instead that it was a gift from the church for being loyal and kind [nobody would really buy that but at least no one would decline either].

But then again, why let such an item go into the hands of another? Who knew what this miracle item could do for Matthew? Maybe it'll improve his speed, strengthen his low health or even provide him with a skill he'd never thought existed. But in order to do that of course he would have to find a cleric or a mage and let them activate the staff on him.

What do to? Matthew picked up at the staff from the stash and looked at it more closely. It felt to fine and light, he was almost jealous that he couldn't use it.
111.title: The Sneaky Thief And The Stolen Staff

choices: Matthew is on the ground only a few inches tall!
Oh no! The staff was accidentally aimed at himself!
1111.content:
Matthew thought to himself. The staff was theoretically his and asking someone to cast it on him was no big deal. He'd have to avoid the clergy though. Serra and Renault might recognize the staff's origin. Eventually he settled for Erk, the purple haired mage. Matthew would have to offer him something in return for helping him and grabbed a few gold coins from his pouch before heading off.

Moments after the thief was showing the staff to Erk who viewed it with suspicious eyes. "Are you sure you found this staff lying in the woods? It looks pretty valuable, I doubt anyone would just lose it like that." Erk waved the weapon around to get a feel on how it gripped.

"Oh yeah of course! Now do you want the gold or not?" Matthew tapped his foot impatiently. He was both curious and excited to see what his stole-er found artifact could do.

"Alright, but I'm not liable for any damages..." Erk sounded doubtful but began drawing from the magic within the staff. A white light glowed and quickly surrounded the two, blinding Matthew. "Hey Erk you're sure you're doing this right?" He shouted with his eyes closed.

"Yes, well I think so anyway!" Erk shouted back. His hand couldn't let go just yet but the light had blinded him as well. The magic felt strange but not unpleasant and he could feel it targeting Matthew.

After a few minutes the light faded. Erk cough and opened his eyes, waiting to see the results of his actions.
1111.title: Erk Lends Matthew a Hand

choices: During That Night Kent Begins To Grow Smaller
The Next Day When Everyone Is Out To Stop A Raid, Kent Finds Himself Alone & BIG
112.content:
Damn. Trying to pursue the merchant to cheaper prices was obviously non-functioning. He should have known that the most famous lance seller wouldn't be able to be haggled with easily.

"Well if you want to be a fine cavalier or paladin one day you'll most definitely need a good killer lance." The traveling merchant was talking again. "All the famous ones did anyway. I even sold a nice one to your friend the other day. A real good killer lance too, the head was dipped in the most vile of poisons."

The "friend" that the man was talking about was Sain. Kent had been astonished when his companion brought back the fine weapon, grinning from ear to ear. Somehow Sain's people skills and high charisma had worked on the merchant ; he had sold it to him for a merely 100 coins. And yet here Kent was being offered a deal of 5000 coins, enough gold to buy himself a promotional crest.

"Look sir." Kent was polite but it had been clear for the past hour or so, his people skills were not very exceptional. "I really believe you can offer a much better price." He cringed at himself once again begging the old man to lower his prices to at least 2000 coins (that was all he was able to take - the party was low on fighters and weaponry and there had been few rewards from villages in the past few weeks).

The merchant sighed, for he too was tired of all this haggling and arguing over something so casual. "Tell you what young man. You like a promising paladin. I will give the weapon as a gift to you, for free." Kent could hardly believe his ears. He was about to utter a thank you when he was interrupted. "Now don't go getting all happy and such. There is a catch. I will donate the fine weapon to you if you can take this off my hands."

The merchant took out a small triangular bottle with purple liquid inside. The cap was a green cork held onto the bottle by a black ribbon. "Now this thing was given to me by a druid to the north. However it vexes me so. I despise the presence of it in my shop. Please, if you are willing to take this accursed potion off my hands, I will gladly give you the item."

Kent frowned a bit. "Is the drink poisonous?"

The old man shook his head, "Oh no no. The druid promised me the potion does no harm to anyone. However I dislike magical items very much. but still the potion has brought me much curiosity. If you drink the potion I will not only give you the lance but also a bonus of 5000 coins."

Kent was chocked. The lance AND 5000 coins. That would have filled the group treasury high. It would make Sain jealous when he realized Kent had achieved so much over at the lance seller's. This was an offer he could not refuse. "I'll do it!" Was the eager reply.

The merchant's face lite up. "Good good! Here you go!" He held out the potion towards the young man, not wanting it in his presence.

Kent slowly accepted the item but was not hesitant to pop off the cork and allow the sweet liquid to pour into his mouth and stomach. Smiling Kent then held up the empty bottle. "Tada! Now if you will allow me..."

The merchant waved his hand. "Go ahead." and Kent raced forward and accepted his reward. He almost ran back to camp. Wait till the others see this!
112.title: The Deal

choices: Kent Decides To Go Shrink Someone In Camp
Kent Decides To Use His Abilities On Himself
1121.content:
His face was full of smiles. On his back was a long steel lance. This certainly had been a great day for Kent. He didn't want to seem too eager when he entered the tent, but it was hard not to start running. After all, although Kent was the more hardworking one, he was never the "sociable", so when things worked his way in that area, he was very eager to show off his skills to Sain as a way of saying "Hey look. You're not the only one with a nice smile."

In the height of all the excitement, Kent felt a strange feeling. It was like a dark magic had overtaken him, cursed him. Glancing down at his fingertips, Kent could clearly see black sparks shooting from them. Stopping in his tracks he observed the seemingly magical sparks. Had he somehow gotten the power to cast magical spells? Was this because of the potion? Yes! Kent grinned. Not only had he succeeded in getting a fine weapon for free but also now was able to cast magical spells.

Wondering what they did, Kent decided to test his new profound skills out. Aiming at a nearby bush, Kent let go a surge of power aimed directly at it. A black aurora surrounded the thing and within a few moments, it had been reduced to 1/50 of it's original size.

Kent stood there shocked. Wow. Was this what his powers allowed him? To ability to shrink things? Wild ideas began to fill the young knight's mind. Would this spell work on humans? The idea of a tiny Sain or another general forced to do to his will amused Kent. But there was a lot more things he could do with his new found powers.
1121.title: Magical Powers?

1122.content:
During his sleep that night, Kent had an awfully strange dream. He dreamt that he was shrinking and everything around him was growing to gigantic proportions, his weapons, the group's collection of mage scrolls. His friends were standing around him, astounded at what they were observing. Kent watched as he became smaller and smaller passing his friend's waists, knees and finally standing tiny in front of a large pair of boots. He looked up (way up) into the face of his friend Sain. He was grinning and smirking at the tiny Kent. "Oh look! What do we have here? A tiny useless bug perhaps? Kent always did say bugs deserved to be crushed, so I suppose I'd better.." Kent's face paled and shook his head. "Hey hey!" He attempted shouting at his gigantic friend but was shocked to find his voice tiny and unheard by everyone.

"Ha ha ha. This'll be fun." Sain lifted his foot up in the air above Kent's tiny body. Kent, too scared too move stood frozen as he looked up at the bottom of his former friend's boot.

Then slowly the shoe lowered, darkening the area around Kent with a large foot-shaped shadow. Down and down it came, until it was right above the shrunken knight. He could have even reached up and touched...

Kent sat up, gasping. It was morning. Everything had just been a bad nightmare.

Rubbing his eyes, Kent took a good look around. Wait. Was he still in his dream? Why did everything look so small? Panicking, Kent stood up on his bed, peering around and the edges of the bed, which was far far away.

And then the door to the room was pushed open. "Hey Kent! Lord Eliwood wants us up and early today for...woah. What happened?"

Kent turned to face the giant intruder. Even in his shock he could tell that it was . . .
1122.title: A Bad Nightmare Turned Real

choices: Sain who had come back from reporting
A curious Heath, who was looking for Lord Hector
11221.content:
"Well well well. What do we have here?" The tall image of Sain, the cavalier appeared in the doorway carrying a parchment of paper.

"Sain!" Kent was relieved to see his partner standing there. If anyone could help him, it would be the person that had been with him for the past few years. Frantically he jumped up and down, waving his arms while making sure he didn't fall to his death several feet below (the clothes he had worn to bed were sliding all over the place on the sheets).

"Calm down. I see you." Sain waved his hand as he walked over to the bed and keeled down beside it to get a better look at the tiny shrunken Kent who sat down and looked back up at the giant face that belonged to the famous green knight.

It was Sain who began the conversation. "So, do I need to ask why you've been shrunk to such a tiny size?"

"I have no idea what happened Sain, we need to get me to a cleric or a healer right away! Maybe then can counteract-"

"Slow down Kent!" Sain frowned at the tiny orange knight. "We need to take it once step at a time. How about this. I take you to go see Lucias when he's awake. But first I need to report to Lord Eliwood. He wanted to show us the new hero crests he obtained. It's not important for us, but I still should go see him ok?" Sain stood up, his figure becoming a blur for a few seconds to Kent. "Now don't go anywhere...*snicker* as if you can."

Kent looked up at the grinning face of Sain. "This isn't funny you know."

"On the contrary, I think it is." Sain winked before turning back and heading out the doors leaving Kent alone on the bed.

Minutes passed before Kent heard noise outside his room. The sound of footsteps approaching. Maybe Sain was back. Kent had been sitting here this whole time, unsure of what to do. He couldn't get his weapons, now that they were several times bigger than himself and he definitely couldn't put on his bright orange armor anymore. He would have to stick with the shirt and pants that he always wore to sleep instead.

And then the door swung open. It was so sudden that Kent was startled, even more when he saw a figure come into the room. Clearly it was...
11221.title: Counting On A Bestfriend

choices: Of course not! This is all just a joke!
112211.content:
"Okay so Eliwood's going to be blabbing about that thing for a couple of hours at least so I don't think we can expect much help from him." Sain slid back int the room with a gloomy face. "Do you have any other people we can get some help from? Hmm?" Sain grinned at the tiny figure of Kent on the bed. Before he had always been considered second best to his partner. A lackey, a second banana. But now look at who was in charge. Seeing Kent so small and powerless made Sain feel wonderful, and he wasn't about to hide it.

Sighing Kent got up and began pacing around the bed. "Okay well there's always Lucias right? Oh wait..he's probably with Lord Eliwood as well. I hear he's taken quite a interest in promotion items too." Kent stood still and closed his eyes. Was there nobody available to help him? Someone who was not busy? He didn't want to make someone go out of their way just to sort out a little problem like this (pardon the pun).

"If I may suggest.." Sain interrupted Kent's train of thought. "Why don't I take you back to my room and have a look through some of the army's scrolls? Erk the mage has been dumping quite a bit of his extra tomes in my chambers and maybe one of them is the cure to all this.." Sain gestured to Kent's tiny size and was unable to hold back a giggle.

"This is not funny Sain." Kent spoke with a serious tone while looking up at the giant face of his partner.

"Oh yes it is." Sain replied with a snicker. "Why you're so small I could do anything with you. Look!" He picked up Kent who gasped in shock and struggled with no prevail. "Aha, why you're so small I could easily step on you with my boot and crush you. Lookie here!" Sain placed Kent on the ground in front of him. The tiny knight fell on his back and was too stunned to move.

Sain put on an evil grin and raised his foot. "I'm not joking Kent. I could just crush you to death right here, right now." He hovered his foot over his tiny friend.

Kent gasped. It was like his nightmare had come true. He could see the bottom of Sain's boot. They were longer than his whole body. If it was lowered...

Sain smirked. He wasn't really going to do this. This was all just a practical joke - something he was using to fool his friend.

Or was it? Could he really step down and stomp his best friend to death? Why not? He was so small and pathetic to Sain. A bug. Lord Eliwood would probably reward him for getting of such a -

What was he thinking? He couldn't really crush his best friend, could he?
112211.title: Sain's Joke

1122112.content:
Kent was fuming. What on earth was Sain doing? "This is no time for jokes Sain!" Kent turned bright red as he was forced onto the ground from his friend's giant shoe. "You should be looking for help!"

Sain's face fell and he stood rigid. For a moment he just stood there, foot inches above Kent and made several upset looking faces. Eventually he spoke and moved his foot. "Oh come on Kent. I was only joking. Besides, you know it's the truth."

Kent let out a gasp of air he had been holding. "Even if it was, this is no time to demonstrate it!" The orange knight pulled himself slowly and dusted himself off. "Now go look for a cleric or a mage or something. We need to find out what exactly has happened to be, and most importantly, how can we reverse it."

Sighing Sain plopped himself down in front of Kent and looked at his tiny friend. "Ok, say I go out and find someone. What if they can't reverse it? What would you do then?"

"Well Sain.." Kent sighed and started a reply but was interrupted by a knock on the door...
1122112.title: [Not] Very Funny Sain

That the light had hit him and he was shrinking!
That the light had hit Erk, who was shrinking before his very eyes!
114.content:
Slash and slice. Slash and slice. The young lord Eliwood was practicing his sword skills under the observant eye of Marcus, the experienced Paladin. Unfortunately, the session mostly consisted of Marcus scolding Eliwood on his poor skills and form. It had only been a week since he left in search for his father and already it had seemed like he had been doing this for years, with Marcus consistently picking out his mistakes in swordfighting.

'Alright, that will be enough for today." Marcus sighed and began walking off towards the direction of his tent. "But you must practice more Lord Eliwood. Surely you want to be strong enough to survive by yourself out there."

Eliwood turned bright red. "Of course Marcus. You have my word for it."

He turned away from Marcus and began a fury of slashes and swings with his rapier. He was so focused on his movements that he didn't notice that Erk the mage had silently slipped up.

"You look like if you were fighting for your life my world." Erk spoke seriously. "Almost as if Serra was after you."

At that Eliwood stopped and forced himself to stifle some laughter. "Oh come now. Serra isn't that bad."

"You have no idea." Erk replied. "But we should get to the point. I came to ask you on your opinion on this new spell I've been working on. It's a blend of the dark spell Luna and my own personal favorite - Elfire. I'm sure it will be much use to our army when it is done."

Eliwood leaned in to look at the tome Erk held up. It was covered with scribbles and notes, none of which made any sense to him.

"Ah..mi..fa do si cualasa..." Eliwood read out loud.

"HEY!" Erk quickly snatched the book back. "I'm very sorry my lord but that spell is unfinished. If it's cast then unexpected -"

At that moment a burst of golden light shot out from the tome and into the air silencing both of the two. It was blinding and it seemed to be aiming at something. No wait! It was aiming at someone! The light shot down at the two and the air was filled with light that was whiter than snow. When it all cleared, Eliwood realized...
114.title: The New Tome

1142.content:
"Master Eliwood, are you all right!?" Erk's voice sounded before the light completely subsided. Eliwood came to on the ground, staring up at Erk peering over him. It took him a second to fully grasp what just happened.

"Yeah." He made out before being helped to his feet. "I apologize." He spoke, realizing how reckless he was being. Erk shook his furiously.

"The blame is all mine. I should've warned you before showing you." Erk insisted. "You may want to lay down in your tent; there could be some nasty side effects." Eliwood nodded slowly, now worried by the warning. "Would you like me to escort you back?"

"That won't be necessary." Eliwood replied quickly, "If I may ask, could you inform Marcus of the incident? He should know."

"Of course, my lord." Erk nodded and hurried out of the training tent. Eliwood himself left quickly as well and began across the temporary base. Along the way his body began to feel a bit sore and it seemed like his pace was gradually slowing. He simply shrugged off the circumstances as a result of Erk's spell thinking that it was messing with his senses. He didn't realize anything was wrong until he bumped into the group's pirate, Dart.

"Hey, watch where you're goin--!" Dart growled before realizing he was speaking with the leader of their army. "Ah, my bad." He muttered awkwardly, not used to be in the presence of royalty. "Say, you don't look to well..." Eliwood glanced up the large pirate in front of him. He did a double take when he realized that the pirate now stood slightly taller than he last recalled.

"Yeah, I was just heading back to my tent..." Eliwood replied feeling a bit dazed. "If you would kindly excuse me." Eliwood brushed around him quickly with a new realization. There's no way Dart had grown a few inches within the last day...and it would explain why it seemed like he wasn't walking as fast. It only took another minute for him to enter his own tent and sit down on the makeshift bed. With the present fear of shrinking upon him, Eliwood found it difficult to sleep or not worry.
1142.title: From the Light

11421.content:
Across camp, Dart was sitting in his own tent, deep in thought. He had literally just insulted Lord Eliwood, the highest person in the army. What would become of him now? The pirate had been sent here by his own captain in hopes he would be of use to the army. He couldn't let his captain down by being deported back to the ship for misbehavior. As the representative of the ship, Dart had to leave a good impression on Eliwood. Too many people believed that all pirates were horrible village ransacking thieves, and Dart wanted to change that view. Not to mention traveling with Eliwood meant seeing things on land he'd never be able to see on a boat, and to partake in battles that could one day become historic. No, he couldn't risk it. He had to go apologize. Too much was at stake.

Leaving his tent, Dart began hurriedly walking towards Elwood's tent. On his way there he was stopped by a worried looking Lyn, who asked him if anything was wrong. Managing a straight face the pirate replied with, "Everything is fine ma'am" before brushing the blade lord aside and continuing on his way. He had to go fast-Eliwood was probably heading to bed early today, especially since he didn't look so well earlier. It could have been a sickness, or something even worse. Hopefully it was neither and Dart would catch the young lord before he went to bed.

When the pirate slowly peeked into Eliwood's tent, he was surprised by what he found. Or rather, what he didn't find. Eliwood's tent looked completely empty. There was a light on the far side from a burning candle but the Lord's bed looked empty. There was a rough looking sheet on it, but there was no bump underneath it. Where had Eliwood gone? Dart was sure he saw the young lord come in.

Stepping quietly into the tent, Dart took another good look around. It was then he noticed something strange underneath the covers. There was a shape there, but it was too small to have been noticeable from where he was before. It was too small to be a person, in fact it looked like Eliwood had stuffed an small dagger in there.

Dart began to worry. If there was a dagger in there, then someone was out to get Eliwood. Rushing over to the bed the pirate flung the sheets off, expecting to see the shiny metal object. What he saw instead however made his jaw drop right open.

Underneath the sheet was the tiny shrunken figure of Lord Eliwood, laying on his side, sleeping away as if nothing had happened. Dart couldn't do anything but stare. Was he dreaming? How did this happen? And most importantly, what was the pirate going to do now?
11421.title: A Most Shocking Discovery

11422.content:
Geitz mumbled something about life as he made his way towards Eliwood's tent. Lord Hector had assigned him of all people to deliver a note to Lord Eliwood, something about tactical formations for castle invasions. The warrior wasn't looking forward to seeing Lord Eliwood. As much as he respected his commander, he never felt that close to the man and often avoided him in combat, fearing that Eliwood would be able to see through his mask and into his past. Today however, the meeting was unavoidable.

Eliwood's tent was quiet and rather dark, leading Geitz to believe the Lord had fallen asleep. A small, rather childish shaped lump underneath the covers on the makeshift bed confirmed this. The warrior was rather relieved and quickly tossed the note on a small wooden table nearby.

As he was about to exit the tent however, Geitz noticed something strange. The lump on the bed seemed different, smaller than what it had been when he had come in. Curious, he made his way over to the bed and examined it. He was sure he could make out a lump of Eliwood's red hair coming out from under the covers. Something told him that things were out of the norm.

Holding his breath the warrior pulled the sheets. What he found was shocking. Eliwood was indeed there, fast asleep but only half his regular size. It took only a moment for Geitz to figure out what had happened. Eliwood was shrinking, fast.
11422.title: Geitz Stumbles Upon Eliwood

choices: "Indeed The Brave Bow! You are correct!"
1151.content:
Wil was stumped. Staring at the two bows laid out before him, he had no idea which one was the Brave and which was the Killer. Normally the two kinds had distinct differences, but these were almost identical. In fact the only thing separating them was that the one of the left had a moon carving onto it's wooden handle.

"Give up yet?" The cheeky thief Matthew was practically grinning from ear to ear as he looked at the crease in Wil's forehead. "You know, if you keep frowning like that it's going to become permanent!"

Wil frowned even more, and he ignored the babbling thief. Oh why had he agreed to take this challenge anyway? Oh ya, it was because he thought every bow of it's own kind looked the same. Boy what a fool he had been.

"Come on guess! Which one is the killer? Don't forget," Matthew smiled innocently as he began to recite the rules of the guess which bow is which game he had slyly asked the archer to play. "If you guess right, I will gladly hand over 10000 coins as a reward AND you can keep the bows. However if you guess wrong.." Matthew put on a silly "evil" expression, "You're in for a punishment of mine."

Wil sighed as he listened to Matthew talk. It was obvious the sneaky little thief had tricked him and set out identical bows. The best chance he had was to guess. At least there was a 50/50 chance..as long as Matthew kept his promises anyway. And so what if Wil guessed wrong. How bad could a punishment coming from someone like him be? Matthew probably make him do something silly like dancing in front of the ladies [Lyn often found this punishment from Matthew very amusing and so did Fiona].

Ah...Fiona. Thinking of her made Wil smile. Even if he guessed wrong, he'd still have a chance of seeing Fiona giggle and laugh. It was rare for him to see such a sight normally - the young Pegasus knight was awfully bashful around men and archers. Considering he was both, Will hardly ever had a chance to confront her. But this...

"Alright!" Will straightened up and put on a good show of confidence. "The brave bow is...THIS ONE!" He pointed to the bow without the moon craving and grinned.

"Ahem...is that your final answer?" Matthew looked suspiciously giddy but before Will could speak, he cut him off. "Well too bad if it isn't. There's no changing it. The bow you selected is..."
1151.title: A Game Of Chance

11512.content:
Wil stared up at Matthew. "What, what do you mean this isn't the right bow. I'd think I would know bows Matthew. Don't waste my time."

Matthew grinned cheekily back at him. "Nuh uh, you made a bet. Now you've lost and you want to back out of it Wil? That doesn't seem fair now does it?"

The archer looked at Matthew with impatience, his fingers curling into a fist at the thought of having to do something for this prankster. He always fell for them, every single time. "Alright Matthew, what do I owe you now. 600 coins? My red gem? A lock of Lyn's hair?"

Matthew looked disgusted. "What kind of person do you take me for Wil? I don't want her hair. I just need you to try on this charm I found." The orange haired thief removed a small trinket from the thieving pouch he kept around his waist. "I found it at the bandit's cave last time. It doesn't seem to be worth much but it probably has some kind of magical enchantment on it, or else they wouldn't have been guarding it in the first place." He took the golden object/necklace and handed it to the archer. "Just try it on for me, nothing else."

Wil took the necklace and looked at it with curiosity. It didn't look too special. He could see there was what might have once been a white gem in the center but it was so dusted he couldn't be sure. Looking back at Matthew he found the thief already diddling off. Matthew never had much of a long attention span anyway.

Deciding that it wasn't too dangerous (and that a bet was still a bet), Will slipped the object around his neck. Most likely it wouldn't even do anything, and if it killed him them at least his death would be on Matthew's hands.

With the necklace securely fastened, Wil headed off to target practice. He wasn't going to stand around doing nothing while he waited for something to happen to him.
11512.title: Wil Is A Bad Guesser

115121.content:
The archery range was usually set up a distance from the camp itself...for safety purposes. As Wil paced through the forest on his way to the range, he tugged at the amulet hanging around his neck. It was somewhat uncomfortable, but his real problem with it was the fact that Mathew had given it to him. Sure, Mathew probably wouldn't throw him in harms way in the name of a good joke, but he was still an excellent prankster. It was probably only a matter of time before his hair turned green or something along those lines.

This wasn't the case. A split second later, Wil's head felt insanely light and his vision began to dim. He began to stumble forward as his legs gave out beneath him. He dropped the iron bow he had been carrying with him and fell forward onto the ground, just shy of bashing his head into a nearby tree. Moments before falling unconscious he felt his body go completely numb.

A few hours later, he opened his eyes. The sun, which was overhead when he blacked out, was now blocked out by something. Along with this, the tree Wil had fallen next to seemed much taller and wider. He slowly stood up again, gasping at the tree next to him. What had happened didn't sink in until he saw the amulet laying behind him.

"The amulet!?" He gasped, seeing the string that had tight been around his neck not too long ago now make a large circle around his body! And to shock him further, the bow he had dropped was nearby also; he was about as tall as it was wide. "It...shrank me..." Wil stated the obvious. "Mathew...he better come looking for me..."

Figuring that someone would be more likely to notice an amulet and bow on the ground, Wil planted himself next to the amulet and waited for anyone to show up. He could only pray that it was someone who got along with him...
115121.title: Fallen in the Woods

choices: Wil recongizes the giant as someone he knows...
Wil can't make out the giant's features...but the giant certainly notices him
1151211.content:
While Wil laid there clinging onto the amulet, someone else was getting ready to begin their hunt.Back at the camp Matthew had teasingly directed on of his friends towards Wil's direction. The thief had already knew what the amulet did of course. He didn't just hand mysterious relics out to just anybody. But he wanted to fool around with Wil first, play some tricks on him. That was why as soon as Wil was out of sight, Matthew went and hunted down the person who he knew was right for the job. A person who was blind when it came to small things but innocent enough not to question anyone. Of course, that being said Matthew didn't exactly tell the person that there was a tiny archer lying around where he was going. Hopefully Wil would be smart enough not to get stepped on.

Back in the forest, Wil tried to get a grip around his current situation. Yes he was about the size of a bug. Matthew had done this. Would be come looking for him? Of course he would. Matthew couldn't just abandon Wil like this right? Somebody had to come. How was Wil going to get help without-

Suddenly the archer was thrown from the amulet and tossed onto the ground. A loud thumping sound came nearby, creating earthquakes for the shrunken archer. Somewhere in his mind it registered that the sound came from somebody's footsteps, but it was hard to tell with him holding down his lunch as the vibrations became stronger. Wil grabbed for the amulet, latching himself on it's side and held on for dear life as the sound came closer and closer. What was happening?

Luckily for Wil, his battle experience came into play at the right time and he looked around. Before him was the giant skyscraper of a dirty, dirty boot. Wil's eyes grew wide as he saw the colossal thing come near him, raising and falling, viciously crushing the grass underneath it. As the boots came closer Wil panicked. Oh no, he was going to be crushed underneath if he didn't do something. No, life couldn't end this way. No way, he couldn't just go like this.

Finding a burst of strength Wil flung himself from the amulet and into the opposite direction. He didn't make it far but it was enough. Within seconds the boot came crashing down on the amulet, where he had been only moments before, crunching the metal underneath it. The boots stopped then and a curious Hm? sound came from high up. Wil pulled himself from the fallen position he had landed in and crawled onto his back. Shaking at the dear death experience, the archer slowly looked up. Who had almost killed him without knowing?
1151211.title: Thump Thump

choices: Wil makes a mad dash for Heath's boot
Heath decides to keep going...crushing Wil in the process
11512111.content:
The giant figure of Heath greeted Wil as the archer looked up. Heath's massive figure made him seem like a giant to the tiny archer, who was probably no bigger than a half of the flier's foot.

Heath was out for a stroll, leaving his Wyvern back at camp for resting. The green haired flier didn't find the day particularly unusual and was busy thinking about advanced flying tactics to try out tomorrow during battle. Normally he stayed away from grassy forests like this, finding it too risky with enemy archers everywhere but today was an exception. The sun was out and the army was resting peacefully in a nearby village.

Down below Wil clutched his chest as he caught his breath. The thought of almost being crushed, unaware beneath his giant friend's boots made him feel sick. He supposed he should call for help but he doubted Heath could hear him at his size. Either way, Wil had to do something fast. Glancing up, way up, he watched as the giant Heath stop for a moment, his tall boots resting only a few inches away from Wil. If he wanted to get his friend's help, Wil was going to have to act, NOW.
11512111.title: Heath Doesn't Notice Wil...

choices: Suddenly Heath continues walking, with Wil stuck underfoot
Heath lifts his foot, releasing Wil's body
115121112.content:
The look on Wil's face turned to complete horror as he watched Heath turn left and right before raising his boots high above the archer's head. Panicking Wil was unable to move, trapped by his own fear as his friend was about to unknowingly end his life. Quickly he gripped the edges of the grass around him but it was no use. Heath lifted his giant boot into the air, blocking out the sun completely for the tiny archer.

Things moved like they were in slow motion and Wil saw his life flash before his eyes. Suddenly Heath's giant boot was above him, crashing down on his tiny body. He could feel the rough undersole against his body as it smashed into him, pressing him against the ground. Above Heath remained none the wiser, carelessly stepping on his friend's shrunken body as he continued his walk.

Down below Wil was struggling, feeling the full effects of having a fully grown man crush his body into the ground. For some reason he was still alive, his face buried in the dirty undersole of Heath's boot. It was probably the soft ground that saved his life, or maybe it was pure magic. Wil wasn't sure. All he wanted was to get Heath off of him.
115121112.title: Crushed...But Not Dead

choices: He Had Cast A Instant Growing Spell On Dorcas!
He Cast A Delayed Growing Spell On Dorcas!
He Had Cast A Shrink Spell On Drocas!
1152.content:
Dorcas was tired. He had been chopping wood all day, using the money to repay his debts to Lord Eliwood and his wife Natalie. Sweaty and weak, the lumbering fighter dragged a big pile of chopped wood towards his house, where Natalie would prepare it and sell to the local merchants.

Today was an unusual day, as Dorcas had chopped much more than he was used to. Somehow he had lost track of time and it was nearly dark. He wanted to get home soon, to make sure that Natalie was safe and that bandits would not come near.

Another few steps, a few more gasps and Dorcas had to stop. This was ridiculous. Even someone as muscular as him wouldn't be able to transport a group of logs this heavy. He had to leave them behind. That meant to inventory to take home. Natalie would be disappointed.

Sighing, Dorcas sat down, tossing his blunt axe to the ground. He didn't want to leave the entire day's work here. But it was getting dark soon and there would be no way for Dorcas to lug all this stuff home. He wished someone could help him.

And them, as if his prayers were answered, a shaman approached from the mist. Dorcas could easily see that it was Ug, a local druid. "Well well well."

Dorcas looked up. He then took no time in asking for the shaman's help.

"I see. What a horrid thing this is. You need to be stronger you say?" The mysterious shaman danced around in a circle, seemingly making night come sooner.

Dorcas nodded. "I'm willing to try anything to get this pile home."

The shaman nodded. "Very well then." He held up a finger and muttered a spell. "There we go! All done." With that Ug, vanished into the mist.

Dorcas was confused. What had just happened?

And then the sweaty fighter felt a strange feeling. It was like a surge of power. What was going on? What did the shaman do?
1152.title: Dorcas - The Tired And Sweaty Fighter

11531.content:
Hector grunted as he pulled his rucksack back up his back. "Why does my bag feel so heavy?" He grunted out so his companion Matthew could hear him. "Did you put more supplies in it again?" He glared at his smaller partner.

"Only a couple of vulneraries and a special potion from the clerics back at Ostia." Matthew responded, passing by Hector to avoid any harsh glares he may gave him. "I would take them but, you're so much stronger my lord." Hector moaned again at his partner's simple mindedness.

"Though doesn't mean you load me up with all of the items you steal. That means you give me an ax and let me destroy anyone in our path." Hector told him, catching up with him. "But what's the special potion you stole?" His interest was touched.

"According to the alchemist who made it, it's some sort of size potion." Matthew told him with a sly smile. "I thought it could come in handy on our quest." Hector's eyes widened. "Imagine yourself as a giant my lord. We could find Eliwood's dad in a moment." Several thoughts came to mind about what it would to be a giant -- to have his power multiply. He reached into his ruck sack and fished out the potion Matthew spoke of. It was definitely a size potion.

"Are you sure this is a potion for giants?" Hector asked, holding the bottle in his right hand. "Did they specify that?"

"Can't say they did for sure." Matthew answered, "However, they mentioned gathering strength." That was good enough for Hector. He held the potion upright and popped the cap off. The thought of being a giant was too overwhelming.
11531.title: Hector

choices: Pick up Eliwood and his group to explain.
Enjoy the strength a bit longer.
115311.content:
Hector felt a tingling sensation throughout his body as he chugged the potion. In a matter of seconds the potion bottle was empty and Matthew stood next to him beaming at the man. "Well, you put a lot of thought into that." He joked backing away a bit. Hector smirked slightly and felt as his body expanded. Hector could feel his long sleeved blue shirt underneath grow with him along with his brown pants but the armor that was strapped on through belts snapped off and fell to the ground. The man grew and grew, doubling, tripling, quadrupling in size. He ended up at an enormous size, with Matthew only being the size of his foot. "Maybe you shouldn't have drunken all of it..." Matthew trembled slightly at Hector's enormous size.

"This is awesome!" Hector boomed, sounding like a huge shout to Matthew. He peered down at his right foot and caught site of Matthew only reaching up to his ankle. All around him he could see mountains and cities from around the region and chances are they could see him. Looking south he could see the point where he was planning on meeting up with Eliwood. "This should be easy." He smirked and crossed his massive arms. He knelt down and grasped Matthew in his large hand held him up to his face. "You actually did something right."

"Thank you, my lord." He could barely hear Matthew speak back. Hector lowered his arm and began at a steady pace towards the point which he was going to meet Eliwood. It only took a matter of minutes for his massive legs to reach the point and peered down over the mountains in the area spotting Eliwood in a skirmish with bandits. He saw the fighters froze and stare up at him in shock. As an act of strength he pulled down on a mountain tip and ripped off a peak, now holding it like a ball in his left hand. The bandits turned and began to flee in fear of the Ostian giant's might. He quickly blocked their way and looked down at them menacingly.

"You've messed with the wrong guy." He spoke, freezing all of them in fear. He dropped the peak to his left and reached down, scooping the bandits up in a handful. He slammed his fist shut feeling an odd sensation in his hand and disposed of the bodies behind one of the mountains. He was loving this strength. He returned his look to Eliwood and his companions, staring in awe at him also. Now what to do...?
115311.title: The Ostian Giant

1153112.content:
Hector knelt down to Eliwood's group and scooped them up also, none of them objecting the giant. "How did you get so...big?" He could hear Eliwood ask, sounding a bit concerned.

"The clerics made a giant potion." Hector explained to them, being loud and clear. "Matthew stole it and I decided to use it, to help find your father." Hector nodded his head at the party he held in his palm. They all looked pleasantly surprised.

"You drank a giant potion to help save my dad?" Eliwood asked shocked. "Well thank you--" Hector cut him off as he curled up his fingers.

"Don't go thanking me just yet." They all froze. In a second he clenched his fist and trapped them all in his palm. "I still want to have a little fun with my size." He dumped all of them into his right pocket minus Eliwood and Matthew, that remained in his left hand.

"My lord! What's gotten into you!?" Matthew exclaimed getting a smirk in response.

"Don't question me." Hector spat, slightly scaring them. "When you're in my hands, you do what I want you to." Hector plucked Matthew from his left palm with his right hand. He dangled fearfully from Hector's hand, worried about his fate in the hands of a power hungry giant. Hector smirked again and brought Matthew closer to his body then dropped him, causing him to fall down his shirt. The belt around his lower stomach remained in tact, keeping Matthew from falling all of the way through his shirt. "Now what to do with you...?" Hector asked Eliwood with the smirk still on. "Why don't you massage my neck or something?" He proposed placing his friend on his shoulder. Eliwood began what he was told out of fear, unsure of what Hector would do next.
1153112.title: Enjoy the strength a bit longer.

choices: Raven begins growing slowly, but surely.
11532.content:
Raven sat around a campfire by his tent as the army came to a rest one night. Not too far from his own was Hector's tent, a heir to the Ostia thrown and the same people responsible for his family troubles. He glared at him in hatred, not understanding why he was working for him in his army. "Do you really need to make it so obvious?" Lucius came out from his own tent holding a Lightning tome.

"Remind me why I'm working for him?" Raven asked, sounding completely ticked off. "If only Priscilla hadn't joined him." He murmured flicking a twig into the camp fire. Lucius sighed and disappeared into his tent again to sleep for the night, since Raven was too hot headed to listen to logic. The sound of rustling grass startled him, making him spin around quickly to spot Matthew stalking up behind him.

"Whoa!" Matthew flinched when the man spun around, "Take it easy!"

"What are you doing here?" Raven asked slyly. It was unlikely to see him around camp at this time. Matthew smirked and took his arm out from the small cape like thing on his right shoulder. He revealed a potion in his right hand, slightly sparking Raven's curiosity. "What's that?" He asked, pointing towards the beaker.

"Canas said something about the enemy attempting to use it in the last battle." Matthew told him, "I thought it would be of value so I stole it." Raven's eyebrow lifted.

"And you're showing me this, why?" He asked again, slightly confused by Matthew's actions.

"He said it would've made the enemy immensely powerful, though just one of them." Matthew continued, "So I figured you'd be a potential buyer." Apparently Matthew wasn't thinking of his master's safety. Raven glanced over at Hector again and noticed his size. He was one of the biggest men in the army, slightly bigger then Raven himself. At the same time that meant he was more powerful and wouldn't need to buy into any of Raven's demands. A little power behind himself might get a little bit of leverage to his plan.

"How much?" Raven asked, standing up. Matthew scratched his chin.

"Two hundred gold." Matthew answered, holding out his hand for the money. Raven gave him an angry look but pulled out his gold pouch and counted out two hundred and forked it over. Matthew exchanged the beaker with him and ran off into the night like a thief should. Raven held the potion out in front of him and contemplated it, would now be the best time. Without a second thought he flipped up and downed the potion, craving the power he was promised.
11532.title: Raven

choices: Matthew can now control Raven's movements completely
Matthew can now control Raven's size completely
115322.content:
The instant the red liquid starting sliding down Raven's throat, it felt as though pure power had begun to flow through his bloodstream. It was an invincible feeling, as though he was too strong and mighty to be stopped by anything. A feeling so exciting that he fumbled the empty beaker, causing it to fall to the ground (it landed softly, so the result was only a few cracks rather than a complete shattering.)

Raven could feel it happening. Slowly, but it was definitely there. His limbs were growing larger, his muscles bigger and thicker, his entire being widening, becoming larger and more capable. He turned toward Hector's tent, the object of his desire, and watched with glee as the tent, once a foot or two taller than he was, steadily sank down so that its top was eye level to him. Then as it reached up only to his throat... then his ever-expanding chest...

When the feeling died away and the process finished, Raven stood at about 12 feet tall, more than twice as tall as he used to be. His eyes never left that tent, which was now small enough for him to kick over with just one foot. Inside that tent was the man he loathed more than any other, the man whose family had destroyed his kingdom and irrevocably changed his life. Hector, Ostia's favorite son. Once, he had been far too strong for Raven to confront directly. He had been a beast, a titan who struck down enemies left and right with ease and shrugged off wounds that would have killed a smaller man.

But now... he was barely more than a little child, a defenseless infant that Raven could snap in two with his newfound power. It was time... after so many years of disillusionment, misery, and loss, it was finally time...

"Sooo, whaddaya think?" Matthew said nonchalantly, as though what he just witnessed happened everyday. As he expected, Raven paid him no notice, too focused on revenge and his newly acquired strength to acknowledge anything else.

"Okay, then..." the theif said dismissively, although, unbeknowst to Raven, his lip curled into a devious smile.

"You idiot..." he thought to himself, "What, did you think me treacherous? Cheap? Simple? That I didn't know about your life, your motives, your history with my lord? Did you think I would sell him out that quickly, for a piddling like 200 gold, no less? Why would I give something so valuable and powerful as this (He held up the cracked potion bottle at this) without making sure there were a few... safeguards first?"

As he finished his thought, Matthew calmly drew a small, brass trinket from one of the numerous pockets in which he kept valuables on his being. He held it next to the bottle, smiling at the indentical markings imprinted on both of the items. Looking up, he continued to smile even as Raven reached out toward the tent, his fingers flexing lustfully, wanting so badly to grab it and rip it open. Calmly, Matthew took his thumb and smoothly traced a pattern over the surface of the trinket, right on top of those mysterious markings.
115322.title: Matthew's More Loyal Than He Seems

choices: Matthew Decides To Use Raven For His Own Personal Gain
1153221.content:
"What?" Was Raven's only word that escaped his mouth before he was frozen into place. A grinning Matthew stood behind him, thumb covering the pattern on the trinket completely.

"Well well well. It seems you're under my command now Raven." Matthew slowly stepped in front of the frozen man, whose eyes were the only thing moving. "I'm very sorry to do this to you, but really Raven. You should someone like me never takes a cheap deal with no strings attached."

The cocky thief let go of the trinket although Raven was still frozen. "Now everything you do is determined by me. And all I have to do is wish for it." Slowly Matthew brought the item to a stop and slipped it into his pocket. "I'm afraid now Raven, that you have no choice but to follow what I say. Or else..." The young man trailed off. "...you may never get to move freely again."

Even thought Raven was frozen, his mind was still active. He was furious. Furious at this low life thief, furious at himself for being tricked to easily. And mostly, furious because he no longer had the power that he craved. Instead it was all given to this "thing!" not worthy.

"Look Raven. I'll make you a deal. If you do what I say, then I'll let you go do whatever. However, if you refuse you'll be stuck like this forever." Matthew walked up and stared Raven in the face with a gleeful expression. "Not really a choice is it?"

Walking around Matthew started thinking out loud. "Now what should I make you, a 12 foot man do?"
1153221.title: Completely Under His Control

choices: Matthew makes Raven have sex with him
Matthew makes Raven display his strength
11532211.content:
Raven's eyes were cold as he stared at Matthew, every inch of his muscles trying their hardest to move. But alas it was no use, the charm had the swordsman completely frozen. Matthew however pranced around with a giddy expression. "Oh boy Raven! You have no idea how long I've had my eye on you. You see, ever since you joined the army...well let's just say a strapping young man like you must be quite good with his abilities."

The thief giggled maniacally. "Well I'm sorry, but it looks like tonight, you're going to be showing those abilities to me, whether you like it or not." He spun around and began walking back to his tent, his long fingers tracing a path on the trinket to make Raven follow.

Raven could do nothing but obey, the lumbering 12 foot man forced by a thief almost half his height. His boots made loud stomps as he moved with a robotic march, following Matthew into his tent.It was quite large, especially compared to Raven's own. He figured Matthew likely lied to get himself something better than everyone else. That bastard.

Suddenly he found himself stopping in the middle of the tent, kneeling down and crouching to avoid his head ripping through the ceiling. Even like this he almost touched the fabric.

"Well Raven," Matthew walked up to the other man and smirked. "What am I going to make you do?"
11532211.title: Sexual Wants

11533.content:
Down to two options per chapter...

Well, how about the pale piper himself, Nils?
11533.title: Nils

115331.content:
Sitting on the side of a carefully made bed, a young boy held a flute to his lips and attempted to forget his sorrows by playing his heart out, a practice that would go without a proper name until far, far into a future even the extraordinary lad could not forsee.

Nils was traveling with what he and his comrades called an "army", but what others would call "a ragtag group of fighters and misfits that only functioned due to an untold number of miracles and an ingenious tactician at its brain trust." And right now, the poor boy didn't feel as though he was doing that group any good.

Yes, he had powers. Supernatural, unbelievable powers. But he had given most of them away to his twin sister, the equally extraordinary Ninian. With the magical, rejuvenating powers of his music gone, he had lost all his use in combat. He was much too small and frail to be a warrior, a fact he was constantly reminded of by Lord Hector, a key figure for the group in both leadership and fighting power, and an absolute mountain of a man. All he could do was use what was left of his powers to summon up foggy visions of the coming battles in an attempt to aid the army's tactician, a mystery man of such intelligence that Nils doubted he needed the boy's advice at all.

Feeling like a waste of space within an "army" that couldn't afford the slightest of burdens, Nils had slipped into a deep melancholy, a sadness he was trying to escape through the one thing he had left: his music. The boy sat alone in a cabin, lazily improvising melodies and playing whatever notes his aching heart deisred.

Then, a special kind of inspiration struck...

"Hmmm... that sounded good," he thought, replaying something he came up with on the fly, "Put it with that... maybe a little of that... Let's see..."

Picturing his hastily composed melody in his mind, he proceeded to play it out on his little wooden flute. Once... than twice... than a few times more, adding in dynamics and changing his rhythm ever so slightly, he finally got it feeling just right.

"Alright then..." he mumbled, proceeding to play his gentle, slightly sad, yet still sweet and slow melody one last time for the empty room, finishing with one final, sustained note.

While he continued to hold the note, a beam of blue light erupted out from one of the open holes of the flute. Before the boy could tell what had just happened, it quickly spread over the rest of the instrument, and then his entire body...

"What the...?!" Nils thought, as the blue aura engulfing his body began to take effect.
115331.title: (Light) Blue-Haired Blues

1153311.content:
Nils could feel his body changing as soon as the aura had surrounded his entire body. Gradually, he could feel his entire being growing larger. His limbs grew longer, his body expanded outward, and his muscles (the few that he had) grew bigger. Meanwhile, the world around him steadily shrunk. His body soon became too big for him to stay on the bed without breaking it, forcing him to stand up. The walls and ceiling of the cabin were closing in on him, allowing for less and less space.

"Oh no!" the frightened boy thought, "I'm gonna get squished!... OW!"

His head hit the ceiling with a pronounced and painful thunk, and then all at once the growing process stopped. The blue aura simply evaporated, leaving the boy to stand around and take stock of his new transformation. As the head injury he just took would lead him to guess, he was exactly as tall as the room was, the top of his hair brushing up against the ceiling. His small, one person bed was now about as long as his foot, and his wingspan was just long enough for him to touch both walls to his left and right at the same time. Strangely, the aura had surrounded and affected his flute as well, so it too had grown to a size where he was still able to play it in his larger form. The most unfortunate change of all, though, was that the door to the cabin only came up to a little below his waist, meaning he wouldn't be able to leave the cabin without breaking something down and drawing attention to himself.

"Ohhh..." The boy sulked, in a voice that had deepened somewhat in pitch, "How am I gonna get out now?"

He stood and watched the door, as though staring at it would cause the answer to his problems to simply enter the cabin at will.

And sure enough...

A sudden knock at the door snapped the boy out of his funk and caused him to break into a nervous sweat. Certainly whoever saw him like this would be surprised by his growth spurt, and they may not take it well at all. Even worse, letting someone see him like this would quickly lead to EVERYONE knowing about his new, larger size.

"Then again," thought the boy, "as long as I'm like this, they'll know eventually. And it's not as though I have any good ideas as to how to reverse this, so... might as well..."

"Come in!" he called out in response, allowing his guest to enter.
1153311.title: The (Not So) Little Piper Boy

choices: Eliwood compliments "That was very nice!" without any change occuring
11533111.content:
"Nils, I've been meaning to talk to you about... Oh! My word..."

Eliwood, the red-haired head of Nils' army, entered the room, his usual kind yet all-business facial expression quickly turning to one of wide-eyed surprise.

"Umm... Hello, Milord! What did you want to ask?" Nils replied sheepishly, thankful that his lord had closed the door behind him, so that no one else would notice him.

Eliwood had wanted to ask him something else at first, but the question that came out his mouth was "How... how in the world did you get this big, Nils?"

"Well... would you believe it's because I played a song I just came up with? I know it's hard to believe..."

"Well, I've seen more than my share of hard to believe things on this journey of ours, so I suppose I should believe it, but... A song, wow... I knew your music had special powes, but I never imagined..."

"I swear, nothing like this has ever happened before when I played!" Nils said, "This is completely new for me and my sister."

"Hmm..." Eliwood nodded in understanding, "Say Nils... Ah, this may seem like a strange thing to ask, but could you, perchance... play the melody for me, so I could hear it for myself?"

"What?!" Nils yelped, holding back just enough so that no one outside would suspect anything unusual from the sound of his voice, "Lord Eliwood, are you absolutely sure? I mean, I don't know what will happen! I could grow even bigger, or something could happen to you, or..."

"Well, we won't know unless we find out, won't we?" Eliwood answered, "Nils, I understand your concern, but I'm willing to accept to risk. There may be some use we can get out of this new power of yours. Besides, your playing is always so lovely!"

Nils still thought it was a bad idea, but when the boss asks you to do something, you do it. "OK..." he said, slowly bringing his enlarged flute up to his mouth and playing out his newly composed melody. In spite of the fact that he had only played it in full once before, he didn't make a single mistake. Meanwhile, his lord simply stood in front of him with his eyes closed, appreciating the music that he was being treated to.

When the final note slowly faded out, Nils looked up to see what would happen next.
11533111.title: Explaining It To The Boss

choices: Focus on a way out of the cabin (if one exists)
Focus on how to use this new found power
115331112.content:
Nils' flute once again began to glow with a blue aura, but this time, instead of surrounding the flute's owner, it flew off of the flute and shot itself at Eliwood, causing him to glow with the aura after it made contact with his body.

"W-what's happening?" he cried fearfully.

"Milord!" Nils gasped in concern.

Luckily, the aura wasn't causing any physical damage to Eliwood. Instead, it had the same effect on his body as it did on Nils'. Steadily, Eliwood's frame began to grow upward and outward, taking up more and more space in the increasingly cramped cabin. When he had entered, he had been about the size of a very young child relative to the enlarged Nils, but by the time the aura took its full effect and evaporated, Eliwood's hair was beginning to brush up against the ceiling of the cabin as well (although he was lucky enough to avoid the painful bump on the head Nils had to suffer.)

"Well... interesting." Eliwood said calmly when he stopped growing.

"Milord! Are you..."

"I'm quite alright, Nils, thank you for your concern. But I wonder... why didn't you grow any bigger?"

"Hey, you're right." Nils said, "I mean, I played it just like before... And I was here to listen to it just like before..."

"Wait a minute, listen! That could be it!" Eliwood cried, inspired.

"Huh?"

"Nils, was anyone with you when you played that melody for the first time?"

"No, I was here by myself."

"Ah... So would you say..." he paused before finished the rest of his sentence slowly, "That you were playing for yourself? That you were your own audience?"

"I... suppose so." Nils replied, still not able to follow his commander's line of reasoning.

"That must be it!" Eliwood said, his face lighting up, "Your audience is who grows when you play that song!"

"What?" Nils asked, even more confused.

"Think about it! You were your own audience when you first played the song, so you grew. Then you played it for me, and I was your audience, and I grew! Don't you see? That has to be it!"

"Wow... come to think of it, that really fits!" Nils said, happy that he finally understood. It was that kind of clear-headed intelligence and analytical skill that made Lord Eliwood such a capable commander despite his young age, and that sharp mind of his amazed Nils to no end.

"After all, that's how it worked when you played for Lady Lyndis on the battlefield, wasn't it? You didn't benefit from your own playing, but the person you played for did."

"Yes, but... I can't do that right now. I gave my power to Ninian, remember? And that doesn't explain why I grew when I just played alone. I never got any extra power when I played all my other songs for myself."

"Well... you're not completely powerless! You still help us by seeing shades of our future battles and giving us advice, right? You can still do that even though Ninian has most of your power."

"Well, alright, but she could never do anything like this with any of her dances!"

"Well, maybe she didn't do the right dance yet... or maybe you're just special!"

"Wow... me being able to do something she couldn't... I mean, normally she has more power than I do, but... wow..."

Nils smiled. Learning that you can do something that nobody else can do is always a great feeling.

"Nils, this... This is incredible!" The expression on Eliwood's face changed from joy to something else. Something strange, almost like... lust.

"Milord?" Nils asked, a little worried.

"This is it! This is the key to stopping Nergal! We've lost and sacrificed so much, but this... Don't you see, Nils? Anyone in the army, ANYONE, can grow up to... this!" He held out his arms, signalling his large frame, "Not even the Black Fang's most seasoned veterans could stand up to an army of giants! We'd be unstoppable! We'd have to nothing to fear! The rest of our mission would be..."

"Milord, please, calm down!" Nils interrupted, "I know it's very tempting, but let's think about this. We're short enough on supplies as is. Growing our entire army would just mean even more of a burden our food and weapon supplies. I mean, it looks like your rapier grew just like my flute did, but it's not like I can grow every weapon we have just by playing around them. I mean, a weapon isn't exactly an audience, is it?"

"I guess not..." Eliwood said, a little disappointed.

"Also, we don't even have a way to reverse this yet. We can't expect everybody to just live the rest of their lives as giants after the war is over, can we? That would just be... strange!"

"True..." Eliwood sighed, dejected.

"Hey," Nils said, patting him on the shoulder, "You just got caught up in the opportunity, that's all. We've all worked so hard and lost so much to get to where we are now, and you were just looking for a way to make it easier on us. You're usually a better thinker than this. You just got caught up in this giant army fantasy because you're worried about all of us, and that's nothing to be ashamed of!"

"Thanks, Nils." Eliwood smiled.

"Now, don't you think we should put our heads together to try to find a way out of here?"

"Well... It doesn't look like there IS a good way out of here." Eliwood sighed, "Come to think of it, as long as we're stuck here, maybe we should talk about how to use this power. I mean, growing everybody is just unreasonable, but certainly using it on just a handful of people could give us a huge advantage without taxing our resources too badly. And before you tell me about how we've no way to reverse this... I've spoken to quite a few people in this army, Nils. They've suffered like you wouldn't believe for our cause, and are more dedicated to it than you can imagine. They want this war over, and if they have to spend the rest of their lives as giants to make that happen, well... I'm certain they'd be more than willing to live with that."

"Now Lord Eliwood," Nils admonished, "First things first."

"Well, maybe someone will show up and help while we're talking? Not to show a lack of faith, but I don't think we're going to find a way out of here on our own. Might as well make good use of our time!"

"Well, Milord, it's up to you as always, but this power of mine is no good if I'm never able to even get out of my own cabin!"

"True!" Eliwood said with a soft laugh as he thought about what to do next.
115331112.title: A New Song... And A New Opportunity

choices: Hector agrees to arm wrestle Nils
11533112.content:
"Heeey, Nils, Eliwood sent me over here to... WHOA!"

Lord Hector, the hulking best friend of the army's commander, had entered. Eliwood, the commander in question, had picked up on the fact that Hector had been picking on Nils for his short stature, and had urged him to go apologize. Needless to say, the sight that met the large axeman when he entered the room quickly eliminated the need to apologize for calling Nils short.

"What the..."

As soon as he saw Lord Hector enter the room, a strange feeling awoke inside Nils. All of a sudden, it felt like this was the best thing that could have happened at that moment in time, and Lord Hector was exactly the right person to enter the room.

"Hello, Lord Hector." Nils said, his lips curling into a suspicious smile.

"Nils... I... Oh, I get it! New power, huh?"

"Yeah... you could say that."

"Oh, OK! Boy, you had me worried there for a second. You and that sister of yours are something strange, that's for sure. Anyway, shrink back down and come on out, would you? We need to get ready for the next battle."

Hector turned to leave, but he didn't go far before a force pulled him back sharply. Turning around, he saw a huge thumb and forefinger keeping a tight hold on his cape.

"Hey, where are you going, Lord Hector? Don't you think we ought to have a little fun first before we go out to risk our necks again?" Nils said playfully.

"No, not really." Hector said flatly, "Now please let go of... HEY!"

The thumb and forefinger had pulled back sharply on the cape once again as their owner said "Well, I do. I'll tell you what, Hector, you always made plenty of fun out of how short I was before. Well, now that I'm a little bigger, what do you say to seeing how much fun my size is now?"

"Ah geez. Look, Nils, I'm sorry about..."

"Yes, I'm sure you are!" Nils said, his voice now becoming slightly aggressive, "But I'm not looking for an apology, Hector. I want to test this newfound stregth of mine against the biggest, toughest guy in the army! So what do you say to a quick arm wrestling match, huh? Between friends!"

"Uh, no. C'mon Nils, this is serious, Eliwood needs us to... WHOA! Would you stop pulling on that?"

"Listen to me, Hector!" Nils said, his voice and face now stone serious, "I'm going to enjoy this new power with you one way or another, and that means, if you don't like my way... well..."

He pulled on the cape in a way that forced Hector to turn around and meet him face to face.

"I'll think of another way!"

Hector gulped softly. Something had gotten into this kid. Maybe giving in to his little demand for an arm wrestling match would get it out of him. It certainly sounded a lot nicer than letting him "think of another way."
11533112.title: A Shift In The Power Dynamic

115331121.content:
"Well, alright." Hector said.

"Good!" Nils said happily, letting go of Hector's cape. He set his arm down on the floor in an arm wrestling pose, bent his body over forward, and got down on one knee.

"Are you kidding me?" Hector said, gawking at his opponent's hand, which was almost as large as he was, "How am I supposed to even do this?"

"Think of a way." Nils said, smiling.

Grumbling, Hector raised his arm and grabbed onto the side of Nils's palm. Nils then closed his fingers around Hector's hand, easily wrapping around the better part of the axeman's arm as well.

"Alright then! Are you ready?"

"As I'll ever be." Hector said unenthusiastically.

"Well then! Ready?... Begin!"

(Now to make it a little bit of the surprise for you, the reader, rather than an obvious "Nils/Hector wins" option choice, why don't we set up a way so that you don't know the outcome of the choice you're picking until you actually lay your eyeballs on the next chapter? Wouldn't that be something? And hey, if you don't like the outcome you picked first, you're free to step back to the previous chapter and pick the road not taken!)
115331121.title: Match Of The Millenium!

choices: "You win, Hector." (Allows his arm to hit the ground)
"You're cheating!" (Grabs Hector and picks him up with his free hand)
1153311211.content:
There was no way Hector could treat this like a normal arm wrestling match because... well, it wasn't. It was case of a giant versus a normal sized man, and even if that giant was just an oversized twerp, it was still a mismatch...

At least, it would have been, if Nils hadn't left him that crucial loophole: "Think of a way." Without knowing it, he had given Hector all the liscense he needed to have a fighting chance.

Instead of trying to power down his opponent with just the strength of his arm (as one would in a normal match), Hector instead pushed the entire weight of his considerable frame against the mass of pale flesh that was almost as big as said frame. Between the heavy armor he was wearing and the axeman's own considerable strength and bulk, he was exerting just enough force to not only match the force coming from Nils' enlarged muscles, but to exceed it. Slowly, the giant hand pushing against him was pushed back, little by little, inch by inch.

Nils was shocked. Even after he had grown to more than twice his original size, he couldn't match Hector's strength. He tried his hardest to rally back, but while the growth had enlarged his muscles, it had done nothing to help his stamina and grit. Quite simply, Hector could keep this up long enough to win, the experience he had gained from countless fights on the front line reigning superior over the giant piper's limited experience of staying in the back ranks, dodging the rare ballista shot or javelin throw.

Nils kept up the losing battle until it was clearly nearing an end. Hector had forced his weight down onto the giant hand to the point where its knuckles were just barely skimming the surface of the floor. It would all be over at any moment.

"I still can't beat him" Nils thought silently, the realization sinking in. He opened his mouth to speak, revealing just how well he would handle this realization.
1153311211.title: Defying The Odds

choices: "All right, all right, Hector. I'll cut it out."
1153311212.content:
Hector thought about just letting Nils win and getting the whole thing over with, but thought against it after coming to the conclusion that all Nils really wanted was a strong opponent to help blow off some steam and newly acquired power. Hector could certainly understand that feeling.

Anyway, that (not so) little brat wasn't about to embarass him!

Hector threw all the strength he had in his considerable arm muscles against the giant hand in front of him... only to have the hand push back against him as though he were exerting no force at all on it!

It didn't last long. Hector tried to have a coventional arm wrestling match against an unconventional opponent, and in the end, even the axeman's near inhuman strength couldn't match the completely inhuman strength that the unexpected growth had granted to Nils.

"Ack!" Hector grunted after his arm met the floor. "Alright, you won, congrats, they grow up so fast. Have you had enough yet?"

While Hector was trying to get the feeling back into his sore arm by making circles with it and massaging his shoulder, a look of pure elation broke out onto Nils' face. He did it. After enduring all of the axeman's taunting and bragging, he had beaten perhaps the strongest man in all of the army in a contest of pure strength, and he didn't even break a sweat doing it. This power... it was unbelievable. It was exciting. It... was intoxicating.

"NILS!"

"Wh- Huh?" Nils grunted, breaking out of his self-imposed trance.

"I asked you if we're done here. Can we cut it out with all these games and goofy smiles now?"

"Well, now, are we done with the games and goofy smiles?" Nils thought with a grin... a devious one.
1153311212.title: That (Not So) Little Brat Embarasses Him

choices: Go out and actively seek help
1153312.content:
Before the boy knew it, the bed beneath him began to expand outward, growing longer and wider at the same time. "Yikes!" he cried, jumping off the expanding bed in a frightened response. Strangely, it took a longer time for his feet to reach the ground than normal.

"Something's going on here, but... AHH!" he turned around to see that his bed was still growing, larger and larger until it was more than twice his height, at which point its rate of growth slowed to a crawl before eventually stopping.

With the growth stopping and the world around him seeming to normalize, Nils, feeling very uneasy, took a good long look around the cabin, which had suddenly swelled to castle size along with his bed. The ceiling loomed far above him, while both the opposite wall and the door to the cabin had moved away from him by large margins, being an extended walk's distance away from his current point, rather than the nonchalant movements they were supposed to be.

It didn't take the clever boy long at all to realize what had happened.

"AH, NO!" he cried out in an squeaky, high-pitched voice, "Now I'm even punier than ever! Oh, what if Lord Hector sees me like this? Wait a minute... will ANYBODY see me like this?"

They had better, he realized, because he was about the size of a child's doll now, and he would need plenty of protection from the new threats that would arise due to his new size. Not only that, but he didn't trust himself to find a way to reverse this on his own. More than anything, he needed to get noticed and get help first.

"Well, OK, but how to do that?" he wondered aloud. He could slip under the door and go outside for help. Obviously dangerous, but at least he'd feel like he was making progress toward his goal. Plus, he wasn't so small that being seen would be too much of a problem, and his innocent looks and vivacious personality had won him quite a few friends in the army. Certainly someone would be willing to take him in.

Staying inside and waiting for help would be the safer option, but it would also be the most boring. Sure, he did have his flute to play on while he waited (having been engulfed by the aura along with him, it shrunk down as well), but after what just happened... well, maybe best to take a break from playing. Certainly a worried someone would come by eventually (his sister, perhaps, or Lord Eliwood), but he didn't want his absence to cause anyone tell much trouble... especially since trying to fix his size would cause them enough headaches by itself.

"Phew... who would've imagined this would happen during practice?" he said to himself as he idly tossed his flute into the air and caught it.
1153312.title: Pocket (Sized) Musician

choices: Play it safe and keep waiting
Take a chance and try to fix the problem himself with the flute
11533121.content:
So the boy waited... and waited... and waited... For hours on end, continuing to play idle games with his flute without actually playing it.

"Well, this doesn't seem to be working" he said to himself as he caught his flute in midair for what felt like the ten thousandth time. This time, though, he decided to take a close look at it before tossing it again.

"Hmmm... If this thing caused all my troubles... maybe it could solve them?"

A good musician knew how to do a lot of things with a single melody. They could slow it down, speed it up, play it backwards, change the rhythm... perhaps one of those variations held the key to fixing his predicament?

"Or maybe I'll wind up making things a lot worse." he thought to himself, fingering the flute, "Yes, there's certainly the possibility of that..."
11533121.title: Waiting...

choices: It worked! But Nils seemed to have overdone it a bit
To the young boy's disappointment, nothing happens
115331212.content:
Nils couldn't wait here forever. He could starve to death! Oh what a terrible way to go! His sister Ninian would have been devastated, Lord Eliwood would definitely disapprove and then the entire party would probably go on without him. No no, he had so much to live for!

Finding a new burst of confidence, Nils picked up his instrument and steadied it. He was going to try something different, hopefully a something that could solve his problems and return the bard back to normal size.

Taking a deep breath, Nils began playing the tune he had first done several hours ago, expect slower and with a more...extreme vigor than before. He hoped that the extra toughness he was giving the tune would cause the player to return to normal.

Almost at once Nils felt something. A strange sensation was slowly starting on his body, head and feet first.
