Excited and finally hopeful, Nils began to play louder and louder, putting more and more power into his revised song. Surely this would work! He could almost feel the feeling of big normal sized again! It was so close...

With an extremely high note, Nils ended his song and even did a little bow to his imaginary audience. All this time he had been experiencing the strange feeling he had gotten a while ago and it was getting stronger. Something WAS going to happen now, he knew it.
115331212.title: Revising The Melody

115332.content:
Still trying to fill this out...

How about the so-beautiful-people-think-he's-a-girl monk, Lucius?
115332.title: Lucius

choices: A few minutes later, Lucius awakes...shrunk
A few minutes later, Lucius awakes...just a bit taller
1153321.content:
Lucius was walking through the arena. Really what was the point of all these days bashing each other up? And just for money too! What a waste of life. He couldn't help but feel pleased to know that Lord Eliwood forbid anyone to come into these places. With the exception of the few bandits turned good, who couldn't get killing out of their systems fast enough and had to resort to killing strangers.

Sighing the monk brushed his long hair out of his eyes. He would have liked to practice fighting a bit himself, for as he was considered "weak and fragile" to most of the party. Just once Lucius would have liked to be able to charge out into the battlefield, unafraid and able to slaughter (the evil ones only of course).

But that was all going to change. Especially with the help of this new blessing he had found. Well given. By the thief of the group, who, without doubt probably stole it from someone. Lucius attempted to brush that bit aside as he took the tome out from under his white robes and stared at it. It was supposed to grant immense power - temporarily. And there seemed no better place to use it than the fighter's arena.

Taking a deep breath, Lucius began to cast the spell, placing his hand over the tome and allowing yellow light to surround him. For a moment everything was right and Lucius felt more peaceful than ever before. But then it all went wrong.

Gasping, the monk fell to his knees, a searing pain overtaking his body. What was going on? Did he miscast? Or was this tome a fake? If so..

Unable to think anyone, Lucius fainted.
1153321.title: Watch Out For Your Health!

1153322.content:
Sticking with a magic user theme...

The scholarly shaman, Canas?
1153322.title: Canas

11533222.content: Okay so perhaps the amazing rider Heath?
11533222.title: Heath

12.content: Alright, the Sacred Stones. Lots of choices here =D Take your pick of your MAIN character.
12.title: Fire Emblem : Scared Stones (GBA)

121.content:
His father was gone on "official" business and his sister was in Frelia with her friend Tana. Ephraim sat alone in his room in castle Renais trying to find something to do without either of them. Various knights had tried to entertain him, and he had even tried reading books his father recommended. Neither of the things seemed to last long since he kept finding himself alone in his room, staring up at the ceiling on his bed. "There has to be something the castle can supply..." He moaned to himself covering his face with his hands. He stood up and approached his desk which has a couple of the recommended books on it. The book on the top was titled "Fun with Potions!"

"He seriously thought I would find a book on potions to be interesting?" Ephraim scoffed pushing the book aside, knocking it over. A book marker feel partway out, grabbing his attention. He slowly opened the book to the page and glanced at it. "Size changing potions...?" He read with curiosity as he read the "fun things" to do with them. Nothing was listed under the giant potion, but under the shrink potion had various pranks to pull. "That could be a bit fun..." He closed the book and stood up. "It'll take a little alchemy though..." He vanished from his room down to the basement where the alchemy lab was set up.

He made one of both over the course of an hour and held one of each beaker. 'According to the book one potion counter acts the other. So which one do I want to choose?'
121.title: Extreme Boredom

122.content:
Franz was disgusted. Disgusted at how the enemy had acted. Turning away from the bag, Franz said with disgust, "I cannot believe they sent us such a thing."

"What?" Knoll the party's shaman was insulted. "This is amazing! I never thought I'd ever stumble upon one of these in my life, and yet you insult it as if it was waste!"

Franz turned back to the stranger he had met only recently. "Look. I don't hold anything against dark magic, but this is ridiculous! Who on earth would ever need a size changing scroll? Obviously the enemy had sent it to us just to add yet another burden." His mind went to Leon, the mysterious traitor to the lands.

"We do not know if this is indeed sent to us my the demon king's host." Knoll almost spat out the words. He was clearly furious at the young knight's attitude. "And size spells are not worthless. If you were ever to be faced against one, you would know."

Franz made a face at Knoll and looked around the nearly empty camp. "Nobody cares about such a thing! How why don't you just take the item and sell it to that merchant? We can use the gold." He turned and headed back to his tent. He did not trust the newcomer, even if the Lord's had approved of him. Kicking the ground with his boots as he went, Franz decided that dark magic was no good at all."

And then, the sound of magical words being spoken started from behind him. Franz turned and faced Knoll, in time to see the shaman furious and casting the size spell by reading off the strange letters and symbols.

"Ah lacka sishma so!" The shaman's eyes turned purple. The spell was obviously launched on him and Franz began to look for cover. He hadn't meant to upset the shaman this much. Magic was a powerful force to deal with and Franz did not want to be the one caught in the middle of everything.

Alas it was too late. A beam of purple lighting darted from Knoll's fingertips striking the innocent cavalier and launching him a few inches into the air. Smoke appeared and quickly disappeared. Within moment the spell was done. Knoll smirked and walked away.

Moaning from the pain, Franz sat up on the ground. He had fallen over from the force of the dark magic. His mind was blank on what was going to happen to him, or what the spell really did to it's users, but in his mind, Franz knew he was about to find out.
122.title: Never Upset A Shaman Because They Will Shrink You

choices: Franz Wakes Up In His Bed
Franz Gets Up A Few Minutes After And Searches For His Attacker
1221.content:
Filled with regret at upsetting the powerful shaman. Who knows what the spell cast on him would do to his body? The scroll had been titled Magical Size Change ~ Chapters 2 And 4 [30 Uses], so obviously it was meant to change the size of things. But how? And how much?

Franz was worried. He sat there wondering. Wondering what was going to happen to him. He had seen the effect of powerful spells and what they did to the enemies that the party faced. True none of those spells had involved size changing in any aspect but still...

Looking up at the sky Franz thought of who he could go to for help. Eventually his mind settled on L'Arachel, a powerful mage and healer who had recently met up with the party. However she had been sent along with several over members to visit a nearby druid that princess Erika believed to be extremely useful.

Sighing, Franz stood up and slowly walked back to the house he was given to stay in by General Seth. There was nothing he could do but wait and see what the mysterious shaman had done to him.

And then something flew by his head and knocked him out.
1221.title: Awaiting Results

choices: Franz Gets Only A Little Bit Taller
Franz Experiences Sudden Grow And Bursts Through The House, Clothes Ripping
Franz Experiences Sudden Grow And Bursts Through The House, Clothes Growing Too
1222.content:
The young man gasped for air. Being hit my a shaman's spell was a very "breath-taking" task it seemed (literally). Franz was gasping like someone strong had smashed him hard, on the stomach, completely knocking him out of breath.

It took almost two minutes for the young knight to recover. He was furious and Knoll and at himself for allowing him to behave to unprofessionally. If the Lord found out...Franz pushed the thought out of his mind. It was only a little spar, no need to inform the others. Standing up Franz brushed the dirt off his outfit. Knoll was truly someone to be avoided, if necessary, alert the others about the new spell he had acquired.

Franz wasn't about to let that get in the way of him continuing the rest of the day. He walked back to his house and sat himself down on the wooden stool used for dining. He was supposedly to share this place with Forde, but since he was out most of the time General Seth had given the house to himself (although nobody had really informed Forde and he visited often saying he had nowhere to go). Today was one of those days. Franz found Forde upstairs, sleeping on the bed he had made only this morning. Sighing and closing the door, Franz wondered like he had done so many times before just how Forde got to be good good at being a knight.

Standing in front of the downstairs window, Franz closed his eyes. Life was calm and peaceful, minus the mishap a few moments ago.

And then the strangest feeling overcame the young knight. He felt a surge of pulling, with the addition that his clothing became tighter. Eyes quickly opening Franz looked himself over, worrying for the first time that perhaps Knoll's spell was indeed something to be invest aged and if needed, to remove from himself.

When Franz looked up again, something was strange. Had the window always been this low to the ground? No. Just a few moments ago it was eye length to the young man but now it was obvious that Franz had to bend over to see out of it. Realization came. The spell! The effects obviously matched the name.

The magic was obviously used to change the sizes of items, and in this case humans too. Clearly Knoll had cast some sort of magical power over Franz and now he was growing taller because of it.

Looking around Franz began to panic. How tall was he going to grow? Would it be painful? Or was it just a small height difference that nobody would notice?
1222.title: The Effects Are Starting . . .

choices: Franz Grows Even More And Destorys The House Completely
Franz's Head Hits The Roof, Knocking Him Out And Stopping His Growth
12223.content:
"Ahhh!" Franz yelped as another shot of growth hit him. Or rather, the growth didn't. The ceiling did instead. Franz was definitely very tall now, his head brushing the 10 foot ceiling. Miraculously, Knoll must have enchanted his clothing too, because they expanded to his vast new height quickly - and thank goodness for that!

Gasping, Franz attempted to bend over. He didn't want to break the house if the spell was going to force him to titanic heights.

And then he remembered. Forde was still upstairs! If he was going to bring destruction onto the house, then he needed Forde out of here! Running and stumbling on the now too small stairs, Franz rushed upstairs, his head bumping the ceiling in various places. His growth seemed to subdue for now, but who knows how long it'll last?

Thrusting open the door to where his "brother" was napping, Franz yelled, "GET OUT!" Forde snapped wide awake and took one look a Franz before questioning him. "What's going on? Hey Franz, you seem tall.."

He didn't get a chance to finish. Another growth spurt had started and Franz was now at least 15 feet, smashing through the door frame.

"I said GET OUT! It's not safe!" Franz yelled once again and this time Forde obeyed, running downstairs and exiting the structure as fast as he could. Standing outside, he could see the house start to tremble slightly. What was happening to Franz?

Meanwhile inside the building, Forde had to sit down. He was too big to leave the house now for none of the doors would have allowed him through. Instead Franz closed his eyes and waited.

Seconds later, the real growth started. Both of Fran's legs shot out from in front of him, each smashing into an exit stairwell. Franz's arms stretched out, his hands pushing against the walls of the room. His head hitting the ceiling, threatening to smash through and break free.

Soon the weight of Franz could no longer be supported by the second story. With a loud smash, the floor gave away and Franz found himself sitting on the first floor, debris and wooden planks scattered around him. But the growth was only beginning.

Franz's gigantic leather boots that were pushing against the house's two exits shot forward and rammed both doors down, his legs expanding and growing. Franz's arms were no longer pushing against the walls of the house - they too had smashed through and were now exposed outside. The only thing left was Franz's head, which was now once again close into the ceiling...
12223.title: House Destruction

choices: Joshua decides to go in and poke fun at Franz
Joshua decides to shout for Franz and wait for the young knight to somehow reply
122232.content:
Franz found himself shocked at his current stance. Sitting there on his butt, both legs out in front of him, having smashed holes through the halls. His arms exposed to the outside by another set of giant circles. Luckily though, his growth seemed to have stopped, as he so found out when the ceiling of the house touched his head in a rather painful manner. All he could see at the moment was the remainder of the walls that used to belong to the second story bedrooms. He couldn't see outside though and had no idea where his feet had landed. His arms could be moved though, although Franz was worried about causing even more damage.

Outside, Forde was standing more than 20 meters away from his former house, unable to speak or even move. He had witnessed what could have been the world's possibly weirdest thing ever. The house was ruined, wood pieces were all over the place along with doors and bits of window. It was even more shocking for the knight to see his brother's giant boots, on either side of him. They were probably the same height as him. Those powerful feet that had just smashed through the walls of the house like it was cardboard...Forde didn't know what to think. He just stood, mouth open, stunned and beyond amazed. How did this happen? What could he do now? Try to get help? Repair the house? Go in and speak to his giant of a brother?

Luckily, someone came by and snapped Frode from his little shocked episode. It was Joshua, the gambling swordsman. He was dressed in his usual outfit, with a sword by his side. What was unusual about Joshua was, that he took once look at the house/giant body of Franz and acted completely unsurprised, like this was an everyday occurrence.

"Ah..tsk tsk tsk. Looks like Franz has been playing around with improper magic again." The young swordsman shook his head as he looked at the scene in front of him. "What a shame too. Such a nice house.."

Forde's eye twitched as he turned to Joshua. "What? Are you kidding? Look what happened! What are we going to do! I mean, he's just so big, like a giant. And the house! Where am I going to sleep? What would Prince Ephraim say about this? I.."

Joshua sighed as he looked at the pitiful sight of the older (and normal sized) sibling. "Look, this happens all the time. Lyon sends us a fake gift, something weird and random and then some member of the alliance army uses it by accident and disastrous things happen. You're lucky all Franz did was grow to a giant. It could have been a lot worse you know."

Forde looked even worse after hearing this. "So..what should we do?" He questioned the other man for advice.

"Go tell Ephraim. I'm sure he has some kind of thing that could counter this. You might want to find Molder too - maybe he can perform some healing magic." Joshua was eager to send the babbling knight away for he was curious to head into the house and speak to Franz - if Franz was still capable of speaking of course.

Eventually Forde left, racing towards the direction of the castle where Ephraim and Erika were staying in the village and Joshua was left alone to peer with delight and curiosity at the broken house and the giant knight that was now trapped in it...Oh boy. This could get interesting for him.
122232.title: A Difficult Situation

125.content: What at one of these fine fellows?
125.title: Other

1251.content:
The moon was high above the Jehanna Desert late one night as a mercenary sat on look out duty for his mercenary camp. This was considered odd for a mercenary leader, taking a late night shift to watch over his group. There was something about the late night that he didn't mind, so this job wasn't so bad for him as it would be for others in his group.

"Hi Gerik!" A young voice chimed behind him. Gerik turned his head to find the youngest member of the group, Ewan, strolling towards him with a smile on his face as usual. "You took the late night shift again?"

"Yeah..." Gerik answered, slightly confused as to why someone his age was up this late at night. "What's got you up so late?"

"I couldn't sleep..." He responded sitting himself down right next to Gerik. "I'm too excited to figure out what this tome is." He held out a black tome towards Gerik. "One of the mages at the campsite we visited gave it to me, as a thanks." Gerik gave it a curious glance.

"And he didn't tell you what tome it was?" He asked taking a hold of the tome in his right hand. "I'm not so sure you should use it. At least get it checked out by your teacher."

"But the mage said it grants a certain strength." Ewan piped up, "It can't be bad if it grants strength." Ewan was just young enough that he didn't quite get the darker nature of the world. If someone said something, it must have been true.

"Anyone can tell you anything." Gerik told him, figuring he was old enough to know. "Your enemies can play tricks on you." He put simply shaking the tome as he spoke. Ewan looked a little bit disappointed.

"So I can't use it until I see Saleh again?" He moaned, slightly dropping his shoulders in shame. "That's a bummer." Gerik realized despite the fact that Ewan played pranks on him, Tethys had taught him to listen quite well. "Well, I'm going to try and head off to sleep again." Ewan stood up and spun around real fast. "Good night!" Gerik waved his hand and turned to find himself still holding the tome.

"Ewan, wait!" He cried holding it up. The young pupil didn't notice and disappeared into his tent. 'I suppose I should just keep it with me until tomorrow.' He set it down beside him and began looking back up at the stars. Not too much later another mercenary came out from his tent ready to take over the shift giving Gerik the chance to sleep. He took Ewan's tome into his tent with him and fell asleep moments later. Just after he feel asleep Ewan reemerged from his tent.

"Dang, he must have been replaced." Ewan sighed seeing the new guy on shift. "He must have taken it into his tent." Ewan darted through the sand into Gerik's tent and found him passed out on a sheet. Just to the right of him was the tome Ewan was looking for. "He never said I couldn't keep it with me..." He spoke to himself as if he was trying to convince himself he was getting around some sort of rule. He reached over and grabbed it, opening it up on his way out. He stopped and stared at the text in wonder as it began to glow a dark purplish color. An aura of the same color illuminated around Gerik, slightly scaring him hoping nothing too drastic would happen. He scurried out of the tent and back to his. Meanwhile...
1251.title: Around the Campfire

choices: Gerik decides to follow after Ewan, heading in the direction of Jehanna castle.
Gerik is overwhelmed by his own size.
12511.content:
The morning came quickly for the small band of mercenaries in the Jehanna Desert though most of them realized something wasn't right as they woke up. Gerik wasn't among them, since he woke to the murmuring of many people around him as if his entire mercenary group was standing around him whispering to each other. His eyes slowly opened as sat up and yawned, stretching his arms up and bringing them back down to his sides. He then realized he wasn't in his tent like he was when he fell asleep. Not only that but there were no tent around him at all. "Hey..." He began but he quickly realized what was going on.

"Gerik...how'd you get so huge!?" He heard a mercenary cry up to him. Gerik was now massive figure in the desert. His tent now laid on his stomach like a mere napkin and one of his mercenaries was the size of his hand. Before he answered, he peered around for Ewan.

"I'm not sure, though it probably has to do with that tome Ewan was given." Gerik answered with his voice booming. "Though I kind of like this strength..." If a mercenary was the size of his hand, his arm was at least two times the size of their body. "With this size I could do whatever I wanted really..." Gerik stood up and took a look around though all he could see was sand. He looked down at his mercenary group and spotted all of them staring up at him in awe. He could easily crush any of them with a single move of his boot so he had to be careful...unless a darker side come out.

"Ewan ran back to town, saying he was looking for a way to return you to normal." One of the mercenaries called up before he decided to act.
12511.title: Giant in the Desert

choices: Joshua goes on the hunt for a target
1252.content:
"I am entrusting this to you my son, I hope you will use it well."

Those were the last words Queen Ishmere said to Joshua before she left for the plains on a desperate journey to find something of importance. Joshua had wanted to go with her, but Eliwood persisted he shan't. The group needed all the help it could find, and that meant the swordsmanship of Joshua.

He swordman looked down at his twin relic, the weapon his mother had given to him. Many thought of the weapon as a deadly killer, efficient especially against the forces of evil. However Joshua knew the weapon's other hidden power. Along with Latona, Joshua's sword had the ability of size changing. It allowed it's user to change his size at will, and also change the sizes of other people.

Joshua stared at the weapon for a bit, thinking about it's "side effects''. Earlier Eliwood had informed the party was going to stop for a while and wait for Lyon's forces. Joshua had been forced to spend day after day in the camp, talking with nothing to do. But maybe it was time for the swordmaster to use the weapon's effects. He could turn himself into a giant, become big and might, maybe even scare Eliwood and the others a bit. Or he could shrink himself down, go and scare the crap out of someone. Or maybe he could go and shrink someone else down instead, as a little joke.

Thinking about those things made Joshua grin. It looked as if the boring days of waiting would be over. Today, he was going to spice things up for the party.
1252.title: Joshua's Family Relic

1253.content: What about one of these?
1253.title: More Charries For You

choices: He decides to hand it over to Ephraim.
12531.content:
The blue headed thief found himself prowling around the hallways of Grado Castle in anticipation of finding an enemy soldier nearby. Sure, Ephraim had taken out Emperor Vigarde but the rest of the troops had been ordered to search the castle for any stragglers who may be lurking. While Colm was somewhat doing this, his attention was mainly on the hope of discovering some secret treasure hidden in the castle; after all, his job as a thief was to scavenge anything he may be able to find on the battlefield. However, most of the rooms seemed to be cleared and emptied, much to his disappointment.

"It's no fun being a thief when everyone else pillages the castle before I get the chance to..." He murmured to himself, reaching for a nearby latch on a door. Much to his surprise, the latch wouldn't move. Needless to say, his curiosity was piqued. He quickly reached into his pocket and pulled out the handy lock-pick and put it to use. It only took a minute or two before the lock on the door was busted and it swung wide open.

Colm entered carefully, making sure that there were no soldiers waiting to ambush him in here but he was relieved to discover that the room was completely empty. To make things better, various treasures were lined against the walls; each a different size and metal.

"Jackpot!" He exclaimed, quickly running up to each of them, giving them a good look for any possible booby traps. "Wonder what these are exactly..." He murmured before yanking, what looked like, a giant family crest off of the wall. He quickly made his way to the next emblem and yanked it off the wall next. On the far side of the stone chamber he saw a desk; without another thought he darted over to it, hoping to find chests behind it. He was disappointed to find nothing there, so instead he began searching the cabinets in hopes of finding keys or clues as to where more of these heirlooms may be.

Inside the desk he found a key with a curious tag on it. "Magic heirlooms...?" Colm read with a hint of excitement in his voice. He quickly pulled the key from the drawer and began looking around the room for any other chests he may have missed. After a moment of searching he let out a sigh of defeat. He figured that the heirlooms probably weren't hidden in this room; they were probably elsewhere in the castle or possibly hidden in a treasure vault below. However, the last thing he noticed on the desk before looking away was a bottom drawer that had a keyhole. Desperate to see what these "magical heirlooms" were, he shoved the key into the hole and turned it. A beaming smile grew on his face when he heard the tumbler shift and drawer open.

Inside the drawer was two small rings that vaguely resembled Guiding Rings; one was a dark blue-ish color while the other was a dark red. Beneath the rings was a parchment with large text on it. Colm fished the two rings and parchment then threw them onto the desk in front of him. Before taking a close look at the rings, he read over the parchment:

Family Heirlooms: the Gleipnir and Garm rings. These rings hold unusual magical powers; rather than boosting the users capabilities, it changes their size. The blue ring, Glepinir Ring, will shrink either shrink the user quickly or slowly through the use of the follow chants. The red ring, Garm Ring, will cause the user to grow quickly or slowly by using the same chants. It should be noted that these rings should only be used when the wearer has both rings with them. This way the effects can be counteracted and will not be permanent.

Colm was stunned by what he found. This could potentially change the tide of the war for them should they give the Garm Ring to one of the more powerful members of their team. On the other hand, this could be useful for his own practice; if he handed it over now he'd probably never get them back.
12531.title: A Particular Heirloom

125312.content:
Two quick glances told the thief that there was not a soul in sight. Quickly he stuffed the two relics into a pouch and made his way out of the treasure room, stopping only momentarily to wince at the thought of leaving without a priceless looking battleaxe that was far too big for him to carry out. Oh well, the two rings he was holding was worth more, at least in his own mind.

By the time he made his way back to the throne room, he was surprised to find it completely empty. By the looks of things Prince Ephraim had called off the search and likely retired to one of the castle's many rooms. It was prime time for Colm to try out his new toys.

Smirking the thief made his way over to the extravagant golden seat and sat down, playing the position of high king for a moment. Unable to contain his excitement Colm quickly took both relics out and rolled them around in his hand. The two pieces of jewelry glowed in his hands. The question was, which ring was he going to try on first?
125312.title: Finders Keepers

1253121.content:
No doubt in mind, Glepinir, the shrinking ring was of the most importance. A thief needed to be a master of the being undetected, swift, agile and able to get in and out of situations quickly. Of course, someone with Colm's experienced already achieved that all, but it never hurt to get a little bit of help. Besides, he had the other ring. He could always reverse the effects if he wanted to.

Grinning the blue haired thief slipped the ring on and admired it. It was a fine piece of jewelry for sure and if it had not been enchanted, probably would have gone for a hefty price at at any merchant. As he turned his hand around to admire the band a sudden wave of nausea suddenly overtook him and Colm found himself slipping into darkness.

After an unknown period of time, the thief slowly regained his senses, moaning and rubbing his head. Was this how the ring worked? By knocking out the wearer without warning? Some dumb piece of artifact this was.

As he opened his eyes though, it was clear that he was wrong. The ring had worked, it just happened when he had passed out. Looking around he was amazed by the sheer size of how everything was, but his senses allowed him to adapt quickly, making sense of where he was. He was still in the same place as before, abet the world around him was much much different. Grado Castle was now a continent, the room he was in a massive field. Colm estimated the ring must have turned him just a few inches tall.

Grinning mischievously he prepared to explore at his new size. Undetected, who knows what he could discover. As the tiny thief made his way for the exit of the treasure room, he was stopped by the sound of voices outside.

"No sir, I believe Colm headed into here."

"Good. I'll check it out myself. Everyone else report to the main hall."

Quickly the thief darted to side, hiding in the shadows of a giant table as the door of the treasury opened.
1253121.title: Tiny Colm

12531211.content:
Colm's eyes widened as the giantic form of Lord Ephraim entered the room, his blue and red cape swirling behind him as he did. From his position and size, it was hard fro Colm to grasp just how much bigger the young lord was and he didn't intend on getting caught either. Pulling himself further into the shadows Colm hid behind a massive table leg, which to him more closely resembled a polished tree trunk. Peeking out from the side he could only see Ephraim's black boots as they entered the room and made small earthquakes as he walked.

"Colm? Are you in here?" The booming voice that spoke caught the tiny thief off guard. Ephriam was so massive, even his voice was like thunder! "Colm?"

As the call came again Colm collected himself. From where he was, Ephriam's boots were about 5 or 6 feet away. That meant me could easily get the young lord's attention. Or perhaps he could hitch a ride instead and be the stealthy thief he was born to be.
12531211.title: The Giant Lord

125312111.content:
Perhaps being seen wasn't the wisest of decisions. After all, who knows what kind if trouble he might get in for just being in here. Instead, he would put his skills to the test.

Darting out quickly from behind the table Colm used Ephraim's hesitation and ran directly at the giant lord's boot, the piece of footwear like a ship he needed to jump on. Launching himself Colm tosses his body on the rough surface, grabbing onto the edges for support. And just like that, he was safely nestled on top of the unsuspecting giant's boot, gazing marvelously at the world around him. It was surreal, like a whole new universe thousands of times larger than his own.

The moment didn't last long though as Colm soon found himself being lifted as Ephraim began walking, swinging his tiny body along for the ride. His vision soon became a blur and the tiny thief could barely hold on. Where was Ephaim taking him?
125312111.title: A Big Ride

choices: Fortunately Colm remembers the charm just in time
1253122.content:
With a grin Colm slips on the Garm ring, the artifact fitting onto his finger perfectly. At first he didn't feel any different, tapping his foot impatiently on the floor. Was the ring broken? Had it all been a hoax? Colm leaned on his elbow and sat casually in the throne. The ring probably just needed some time to take affect, some time for the magic to work it's way through his body. Yeah that was it. Colm relaxed and leaned back onto the throne. Some time was all he needed.

Then suddenly, without warning Colm felt a strange tingling sensation. It was as if something was pulling at his bones and flesh, tugging them outwards. It wasn't painful but yet it was still uncomfortable. Still Colm knew it was Garm taking it's toll on his body and he sat up excitedly, fingers almost shaking with anticipation. This was going to be so great, who knew what he could do when he was a giant. Maybe show off to the others, frighten his commander or go out and crush some bandits with a quick step of his foot. The possibilities were endless.

He could feel the magic wrap around himself and intertwine with his clothing. But wait, Colm suddenly felt like there was something he forgot. Oh yes, the charm! The ring said something about a charm to control the rate of his growth. For a moment Colm panicked, what was the charm again?! If he didn't want to suddenly burst through the castle roof he was going to have to remember it fast.

Or did he not mind?
1253122.title: Colm Wants To Be Bigger

12533.content: What about the amazing Prince Innes?
12533.title: Prince?

125332.content: What about Cormag, the handsome rider?
125332.title: Selections

1253322.content: What about Ewan the aspiring mage ?
1253322.title: Can we move on?

13.content: Oh la la. Fire Emblem, Radiant Dawn. Now pick which character you want to be your MAIN character.
13.title: Fire Emblem : Radiant Dawn

choices: "I Will Take My Chances In Touching The Flower."
"You Are Right, This Is Too Dangerous. Let Best We Move On."
"Well, If We Can Carefully Transport It Back Safely , We Might As Well."
131.content:
"Lord Ike, I really advise you not to do that." Several of the world's most powerful mages were standing in a circle around the Ranger Lord as he stared intensively at a purple flower with pink stripes running along it's sides.

"It is said the flower is to bring forth horrific side effects to anyone who touches it." A female priestess was urgently speaking to convince the lord not to reach out and grab the specimen.

'Yes, but it also can bring forth unspeakable powers." Ike spoke the reply the others all knew was to be said. True, the magical plant, called Igneis Punctilious was a rare plant found only during spring time, and bloomed only once every 50 years. Rumors said, that who ever touches the plant will either gain unspeakable powers or be cursed with the most horrifying results.

A shaman spoke up. "Lord Ike." They were all careful to address the famed warrior carefully, even since he had mad such a name for himself traveling here and there. "I don't believe the consequences may be worth the gain." Several others nodded at his remark.

"But we cannot let a thing like this go to waste." Ike replied. "For all I know, many of us may not even live to see it bloom again."

There was sighs of desperation from the surrounding party.

"Well.." The youngest priestess spoke up. "What if we are to carefully transport the plant back to the castle for further investigation? I believe we can do it without making skin to plant contact."

Several faces nodded and murmurs of agreement came up."Well Lord Ike, it is your sole decision on what to do."

Ike sighed and said, "....
131.title: Ike And The Magical Flower

choices: Ike grows, in the middle of Crimea to make things better.
Ike appears no different. Though he is actually growing slowly.
1311.content:
Ike took a step forward and knelled down to the oddly colored flower and gave it a few seconds of more though. Closing his eyes, he plucked the delicate flower from it's soil and held it in his hand, half expecting to go up in flames or something along those lines. All of the mages clenched and inhaled sharply upon seeing the ranger pluck it. He stood there awkwardly for a moment before shrugging. "I think that may be a fantasy."

"The books couldn't have lied, could they?" The shaman mumbled to himself, "Or maybe the affects simply need more time." The priestess sighed in relief.

"Let's just be glad that he isn't cursed now." She smiled slightly turning for the path away from the flower location. "We better get it back to the Crimean Capital before something happens to you." Ike followed after her feeling perfectly fine. The flower didn't see to have been harmed in the process and nothing seemed to be going wrong. They reached the Crimean University where they kept the specimen in it's own container and thanked Ike for his services and let him go on his way. His mercenary company was in town for the day doing their separate missions to pay the bill and he had just gotten back from his own. While walking through the streets he started feeling dizzy, causing him to fall off to the side of a path.

"I hope I don't start regretting that now..." Ike was referring to the flower. He finally passed out, landing against the wall.
1311.title: Ike's Daring Touch

13112.content:
Loud roaring sounds filled Ike's ears after he awoke from the random pass out. He glanced over and spotted several giants boots step by, surprising him to no end. "What the hell!?" He exclaimed, standing up and scooting against the wall behind him. "Did that flower do this to me!?" He looked around and noticed everything was gigantic. At this size, it would be lucky if anyone even caught site of him, much less be found by anyone is his mercenary group. The sun was beginning to set, and he didn't feel like wandering the streets of Crimea at night. Turning his day around, his luck brought him someone to find him and to make things better someone he knew.

"Ike?" A now gigantic green haired man knelled down to look at the small looking Ike figure he had seen on the street. "Is that you?" Ike peered up at him in disbelief.

"Geoffrey!" Ike yelled as loud as he could, "It is!" Geoffrey's eyes widened.

"What on Earth happened to you?" He asked, picking Ike up with his right hand and letting Ike stand on his palm. "How did you get so...small?" Ike shrugged before actually answering.

"I touched a rare flower that cursed me." He yelled again, barely being heard by Geoffrey. "Can you take me by Calil's Inn!?" He added, straining his voice from all of the yelling.

"I need to head back to the castle." Geoffrey replied. "I'm afraid I don't have time for that this instant." Geoffrey began stepping in the opposite direction Ike wanted.

"Please! My mercenary group is staying there! They can take me where I need them to!" Ike yelled some more, hoping to get what he needed from the giant Geoffrey. Geoffrey slowed to a stop and sighed.
13112.title: Shrunk in Crimea

131122.content:
"I'm sorry Ike, I simply can't do that. I'm already quite a bit behind as it is, I don't think I can make any detours."

Ike looked up hopelessly at Geoffrey. "You can't leave me Geoffrey. Who knows that's out there!"

The paladin sighed once more and looked down at the tiny man in his hand. "I'm not leaving you here Ike. I'm taking you to the castle. We'll figure out what we can do once we're there. At the very least, I can leave you with someone you trust."

With that he continued walking, holding Ike carefully in his handm the tiny ranger making disgruntled and disapproving faces. The trip in itself was quiet and the two seemed to avoid conversation. Perhaps it was the strangeness of the situation, or maybe due to just how late Geoffrey really was.

Eventually Ike felt the giant stop and he stood up, peering around from his point high above the ground. It seemed he hadn't been paying too much attention to his surroundings (Ike had almost dozed off) because he found that he was in an unfamiliar room, decorated mostly with tables and a few benches.

"Geoffrey?" He looked up at the giant. "Where are we?"

"It's one of the waiting rooms of the castle. I'm afraid I have some important business to attend to, so I'll have to leave you here for a bit."

Before Ike could object Geoffrey lowered him onto a table and gently nudged him off his hand. "I'll be back in a bit ok. Don't go anywhere."

"As if I had a choice..." Ike muttered and watched Geoffrey leave, finding himself alone again. Several things raced through his mind. His group might have been looking for him, or maybe they weren't. Either way Ike wasn't sure he had the capacity to be concerned about them at the moment.
131122.title: First Things First

choices: Geoffrey takes Ike back to his room, privately.
1311222.content:
After a while Ike was startled by the sound of footsteps on the ground. He had been so lost in thought, he had failed to keep track of the time. Quickly he looked up to see the calm face of Geoffrey as he the paladin reentered the room and looked down at him.

"Back so soon?" Ike tried to grin. Just because he was shrunk, didn't mean things had to be down.

"Yes, it turns out the person I was supposed to see had actually left for something important, so unfortunately the rest of my plans for today have been cancelled." Geoffrey sighed and crossed his arms. "I guess that's not necessarily a bad thing. That is, if you don't mind spending the day with me."

Ike thought to himself for a moment before looking back up. "We have to find a cure for this Geoffrey. I can't stay at this size forever." He sighed. "But there's not much I can accomplish by myself, especially at this size."

At that Geoffrey let out a small smiled and reached out to pick Ike up in his hand and bring him to eye level. "Don't worry about it. I'll make sure you get back to your normal size. Just bear with me today. I can't leave the castle in case I'm needed."

Turning Geoffrey began walking about of the room, once again carrying Ike in his hands. It made Ike feel oddly safe, knowing that there was a giant who looked out for him at this size.

"So, where are going now?"

Geoffrey's reply was casual. "Just the usual routine."
1311222.title: In His Hands

choices: "Why don't you rub my sore muscles."
"Actually, I've always kind of wanted to play being a powerful giant..."
13112222.content:
"And what's what?" Ike sat down in Geoffrey's hand and looked up at the giant.

"Well, speaking truthfully, I am actually quite tired, so I thought I'd rest a bit in my room." The paladin stopped in front of a door and reached out using his free hand. "I'm fortunate to have my own chambers. Not everyone receives such privilege." The two entered in the room and once again Ike found himself being set down, this time on a chair. He watched with interested as Geoffrey casually removed several bulkier pieces of his armor, leaving only a few pieces on.

"Ike, I don't know if you can understand the pressure I face sometimes. Here at the castle, I have to worry about a lot of things, safety, training, weapons. It's a blessing that my appointments for today have been cancelled. I can finally some some time to rest."

He walked over to the bed and sat down, looking at the tiny Ike which was on a chair not too far away.

"Geoffrey, I'm glad to have a friend like you." Ike smiled back at the giant. "If someone else had found me out there, who knows where I could be now. I know I'm not much use at my current size, but there are some times I could try to maybe help you relax." He stood up and grinned, running a hand through his hair. "I'm good with my hands, I bet I could give you a massage. At this size, I could probably even get those hard to reach spots."

Ike could tell he had caught Geoffrey's interest. The paladin thought for a moment. Yes, maybe Ike could help him out. After all, this was once in a lifetime opportunity. He doubted Ike would ever willing expose himself to such a curse again. "Really Ike? Actually, I do have an idea in mind."
13112222.title: Private Sector

choices: Ike stays and confronts the owner of one of the voices
13113.content:
"Ike! Are you alright?" Several clerics rush over to Ike as the warrior collapsed. The last thing Ike managed to see was the flourish of white robes as two female clerics ran over, staves waving in the air frantically...

Ike grunted. His back hurt, his head hurt. In fact, his entire body felt sore and tense. Struggling to open his eyes, the blue haired hero let out a moan has he tried to pull himself up at the same time. He was in a tent of some sorts, one he had never seen before. There was a cot underneath him and his armor had been removed and placed to the side.The tent was a small one, enclosed from all four sides with only the one farthest away from him letting light through from a partly open flap. From that, Ike could see grass and the outside. It was probably around sometime in the afternoon. Which meant he had been out for quite a while.

Swinging his legs off the bed, Ike began walking towards the exit. He wanted to know where he was, where everyone else was and if someone could do something about his muscles. Everything hurt from his head to his toes.

Just as he was about to step out, Ike heard voices coming from somewhere nearby. He paused and listened carefully.

"We can't just leave him like this. Who knows what will happen? Do we really need a giant on our hands during a time like this?"

"But you said it yourself. The counteraction is dangerous-we could potentially end up with a 3 inch tall Ike."

Giant? 3 inches? Ike was puzzled. What were these people talking about? Could it have something to do with that flower he touched? The thing couldn't have really been cursed, could it?

Just then, Ike heard the sounds of footsteps coming this way. He quickly glanced back to his cot, should he pretend to still be unconscious to listen on some more? Who knows what was going to happen to him if they found out he was awake.
13113.title: Time Flies By

choices: Edward swallows the stone and begins to grow.
Edward swallows the stone and begins to shrink.
Someone enters the tent before Edward can eat the pebble.
132.content:
Edward, the young, skilled swordsman from Daein, was practicing his swordsmanship alone. The practice wasn’t going so well, though, as the sword fighter found himself filled with thoughts that were taking an effect on his skills. The boy examined a cut on a dummy he made from some hay and appeared displeased. The cut was no where as clean as it should have been. At this rate, he would soon find himself further behind all his companions than he already was. Ever since everyone, save for him and his comrades, were turned to stone by some evil goddess, he was feeling a lot more distant from everyone than usual. The tacticians, such as Soren, and the “important figures”, like Ike and Sanaki, were the ones taking the spotlight. He was only good for bringing his sword into battle and cutting himself through the enemy forces. Even that was becoming a rare occurrence, seeing how more skilled swordsman had joined their ranks.

Finding it impossible to train like this, Edward sheathed his sword and headed back to his tent. They were short on tents, so he was forced to share his with a few others. He didn’t mind, but was glad no one was currently inside so he could be left alone for a bit. Edward put his sword on the ground and laid himself on the bedroll, hands folded behind his head. He was about to close his eyes when something caught his attention. Something that looked like a small, green pebble was hanging from he ceiling of the tent. Edward reached up and tugged the rock free. He examined it closely and found nothing special about it, although it did look kind of nice. Something else was hanging next to it: a note. He took this as well and read it.

Swallow this and all attention will be on you.

“Swallow it? This rock? Is it even edible?” Edward asked himself. He took a quick lick of the rock and drew his head back in disgust. “That’s a rock alright.” What kind of joke was this? Did someone know he had been feeling down and given him this to make fun of him? It seemed really childish.

Although, looking at the green stone, something was odd. Edward couldn’t explain it, but the pebble seemed to radiate a mystical force. He could never sense magic before, maybe this was a piece of really powerful magic. What seemed like a joke might be an extraordinary gift! The again…it might also be a trick planted by the enemy! No….wait, that couldn’t be. No one would be able to sneak into the camp undetected. There were traps set up all around the camp…or so he had heard. No one tells him anything, he just happened to overhear it.

“So if I swallow this, everyone will start showing me the attention I deserve? Seems kind of farfetched…but it couldn’t hurt, I suppose. I swear, though, if this thing gives me a stomachache, I’m finding the one who put it here and gutting them.”

Edward opens his mouth and prepares to toss the pebble in.
132.title: Edward

choices: Someone Came Over And Commented On Edward's Height
Edward Felt Himself Get A Little Bit Taller Again
1321.content:
Edward needed no time to think. The possible resulted excited him, and he instantly dropped the stone into his mouth and attempted swallowing. Surprisingly the mineral seemed to dissolve in his mouth, leaving a light sweet taste. Well at least now Edward knew he wouldn't regret swallowing this thing. There seemed to be at least some good in this.

Sighing, Edward laid down again. Who knew how long it would have to be before the effects of the strange pebble would active? He didn't want to sit around all day long awaiting results..

Feeling restless, Edward thought of all the things he could do once he was famous. Maybe give himself the title of lordship? Ask someone to help him with this naiveness? Or perhaps he'd force someone to make him the best sword in the world. Ya. That's be nice.

Edward sat up suddenly. What was that strange feeling? Standing up, Edward shook his head. What was going on? This was getting ridiculous. Maybe he shouldn't have swallowed the stone after all.

Starting to leave to go out into the open, Edward noticed that the roof above his head seemed lower. Had it always been this way? Confused and worried, Edward stepped outside into the fading light. Day time was almost over. Edward guessed in 2 hours it would be dark.

And then...
1321.title: The Start Of Growth

choices: Edward Wakes Up Moments Later, Naked And Alone
Edward Wakes Up Moments Later, Clothed And Alone
Edward Wakes Up Moments Later, Clothing Shrinking Too But Not Alone
1322.content:
Well no point in waiting right? Edward's hand opened and the stone fell from it into his mouth. Closing it, he then preceded to swallow. It was harder than he had imaged. The mysterious stone was reckless in terms of not going on and Edward was equally reckless in forcing it to do so.

Gulping, chocking and eventually gagging, Edward somehow managed to make the green gem go down, feeling uneasy but excited as he did so. Finally he would be able to garner some attention around here so force he would be the center of attention rather than Leonardo. It wasn't that he disliked his friend. It was just that he was too serious and wise, all many of the mercenaries visited him instead of Edward. Now, due to whatever was going to happen, Edward was finally going to get a taste of the good life.

Sitting down on top of a wooden chest that contained several of his outfits, Edward took a few deep breaths, eager for the stone to land in his stomach and it's effects starting - whatever they were.

A few dull moments passed by before Edward began to feel strange. It was as if an vine had rapped itself onto his and was constricting him in everyway. Gasping and grunting a bit, Edward had to lie down to prevent himself from falling over in pain. What was going on?

Horrific thoughts filled Edward's head. Was the stone fake? Was it poisonous and someone purposely sent it to him as a way of killing him? With these thoughts in mind, Edward blacked out, unaware his body was slowly shrinking in size.
1322.title: Blacking Out

13221.content:
Moments later, Edward began to stir out of his sleep. He feels something like a blanket draped over his bare skin, which is odd since he doesn’t recall stripping before he went to sleep. The memories of the weird stone and the painful results that came after swallowing it flood back into his mind. Edward’s eyes shoot open and he sits up while looking around him. The “blanket” he felt was all around him, trapping him in darkness. The air reeked of BO…a strangely familiar BO. At first he thinks the stone had knocked him unconscious and he had been stuffed in a bag, but this was way too big to be a bag. Also, as far as he could tell, he wasn’t moving. With confusion fueling him, the young swordsman decides to see if he can make his way out by climbing up. Ignoring the fact he’s naked, Edward climbs through several layers of strange fabric before he spots light filtering through the walls. He heads for that light and eventually breaks through to the surface, taking in a big breath of air.

It takes some time for his eyes to get used to the light, but once they do he sees that he hasn’t moved at all. He’s still in his tent…except everything is much, MUCH bigger. Still with a puzzled expression, Edward lifts himself all the way out of his prison and starts to walk forward. He soon trips over something and looks at his foot. It’s a gigantic button! Not only that, it’s HIS button. To HIS shirt! The truth collapses on Edward like a ton of bricks; that stone had shrunk him to bug size and he had just crawled out of his own, oversized clothes!

“That stone was supposed to make people notice me, not make it so NO ONE could notice me!” Edward screamed, boiling with anger. If this was a prank, it wasn’t the least bit funny. When he got back to his normal size, he was definitely going to find the person that did this and definitely gut them! The pissed off swordsman made is way off the pile of clothes and onto his sleeping bag. He sat down for a moment to think. What was he supposed to do now? He needed to find help, but going outside to look for some would be suicide! At his pathetic size, he might get picked up by a bird and eaten. He decided to wait patiently for someone to come to him. He didn’t have to wait that long as he started to hear the slamming of boots approaching the tent. The stomping got louder as the entrance of the tent was pushed back and someone entered. Edward looked up and found himself staring at the gigantic form of…
13221.title: Shrunken, Naked, and Alone...But Not For Long

choices: The odds are against him, Boyd grows.
Ike dumbly takes the doused sandwhich.
1351.content:
Boyd wiped the sweat from his forehead as he entered the Greil Mercenaries fortress after a workout at the small training facility. He sat himself down at the table in the mess hall and relaxed his sore body. "You just get done from working out?" Ike asked, entering the room from the kitchen.

"Yeah." Boyd smirked, "I can't believe how much I've grown in only three years. Simplicity is actually pretty effective." Boyd chuckled a little bit, checking out his large arms. Ike sighed and little bit and looked down at his own. His were large and had grown plenty for only three years, but Boyd was basically his rival. If his arms were bigger, he was losing the unpronounced race. Rhys limped into the room carrying a large crate and grunting.

"Could I get some help?" He begged, just about ready to drop the box to the ground. The two other men walked over and assisted him in placing the heavy container on the table. "Thanks..."

"What's in here?" Boyd asked curiously, poking his head closer.

"I wouldn't get too close." Rhys warned, "They say if this spice is used raw it could affect someone's size magically." The other two gave him a confused expression. "When cooked its an amazing ingredient, when used raw it's a magical item. And to make things worse, it's tasteless raw."

"So it's turns them into a giant?" Boyd asked, intrigued.

"On more accounts, it shrinks the victim." Rhys told him, "The amount shrunken depends on how much is consumed. Though the affects wear off after a while if the victim keeps away from the spice long enough." The two men nodded their heads in understanding. "Oscar ordered it for the meal he's preparing tonight."

"How much do you need to eat to shrink yourself to a size people can pick you up and stuff?" Boyd asked jokingly.

Rhys chuckled slightly, "Depends on the person's size. Usually only a handful." He answered, "You see, it only affects you the first time if you inhale/digest it. After it gets in your system, you can be affected by contact." Rhys left them room to go relax in his own room after explaining this to them.

"I see." Ike and Boyd returned to the table where Boyd decided he needed to go bathe before they ate lunch. It was then it hit Ike. "Hey Boyd, I'm gonna make a sandwich, you want one?"

"Sure, I'll get a ham if we have it." Boyd responded and left the building to go bath. Ike entered the kitchen and prepared two ham sandwiches and once he completed them he returned to the box. The lid was already cracked some so he just hand to reach his hand in there...and scoop out enough. 'Boyd's a big man...' He thought to himself. He used his other hand to scoop out another handful. He used his arm to close the crate and return to the kitchen, where he doused Boyd's sandwich in the spice, hiding it inside the pieces of the folded ham. Ike smirked and cut Boyd's in half, to be able and distinguish the two when the time came. In a matter of moments, Boyd returned cleaned off and ready to eat. Ike carried the sandwiches out to the table and set them down.

"Thanks Ike!" Boyd replied trustingly and took a bite out of his. "Taste pretty good." Ike smiled and nodded and began conversing with him, ready to see the spice take affect.
1351.title: The Spice

choices: Show off Ike's might in a workout.
13511.content:
Boyd was about 3/4ths the way through his sandwich when he slowed down a bit. "I'm starting to feel a bit weird..." He spoke and held his head a bit as he swayed. Ike looked up from the table at him with a fake worried look on his face. "I feel..dizzy...numb..." Boyd spoke again, swaying even more then he was. Finally he passed out leaning backwards and shrank before Ike's eyes. His was quickly obscured beneath the table and the sound of metal hitting the floor rang throughout the small building. At first he was worried Boyd's clothes didn't shrink with him, but for some reason the clothes had but the shoulder pads didn't.

Ike stood up from his seat and approached Boyd's unconscious shrunken body. How was he supposed to keep him like this? Oscar was going to be using the spice tonight for dinner. 'It looks like I'll have to take some of it...' Ike thought to himself. He reached down and scooped up Boyd into his hand and grinned. 'Now who's the smaller one?' He slipped Boyd into his belt to hold him temporarily as he went into the kitchen to get a few bowls for the spice. He took several bowls and filled them up and slipped out of the mess hall and made it back to his room without any confrontations. He hid the bowls in his dresser and took Boyd off of his belt.

An hour or so later Boyd came to, spotting his giant friend not too far from him. "What the hell happened to me!?" Boyd cursed, standing up on the night stand and looking around. "I shrunk!?" His voice was loud enough to be heard by the giant. Ike spun around and saw him standing up.

"Good to see you." Ike joked, laughing slightly. Boyd looked furious.

"What did you do!?" He roared as loud as possible. "What did you do to me!?" Ike smirked and reached over to him. Boyd attempted to back away but the larger man grabbed him in his hand. No matter how much muscle Boyd had he could break free from Ike's grip.

"You're so much weaker now..." Ike taunted, squeezing him slightly. "You can't do anything about it." Boyd used all of his might but Ike had him beat. "It's about time I passed you up." Boyd gave him a look of disbelief. "Now that I have you...what should I do with you?" Ike lifted him up a bit to give him a sight of his arm, which was now bigger then Boyd's entire body.
13511.title: Shrunken and captive.

choices: Ike notices before Boyd makes a decision.
135111.content:
"You know, I haven't worked out today." Ike grinned standing up from the bed. Boyd stared in disbelief. The person closest to his best friend shrank him because he had larger muscles then him. "I think you may need to be acquainted with the new strongest around here." At the moment Gatrie and Shinnon were out on their own mission. Ike began out of his room towards the training center they had. The longer he held Boyd in his hand, the better he felt. Ike had always wanted to hold complete power over someone, though not like having a position as a General.

"Ike...!" Boyd called, beginning to be crushed by Ike's obsessive grasp. "Don't tell me this is because I was bigger then you!" Ike didn't respond but rather entered the training and grasped a sword. Ike slipped Boyd into his cloth pieces he had wrapped around his wrists.

"Are you ready to see my arms in action?" Ike taunted, looking down at Boyd on his wrist. He swung his sword several times at a training dummy working the muscles in his arm right in Boyd's face. Boyd attempted to struggle a bit as he swung, wanting to escape from his crazy new owner. At first nothing seemed to be happening but as Ike increased the intensity he began to sweat more, dousing Boyd and Ike's cloth wrists in his sweat.

'This is disgusting...' Boyd gagged a bit as giant drops of Ike's sweat covered his body. 'It's bad enough being covered in my own.' At the same time he noticed the cloth restraining him was being weakened by each drop that hit it. 'If it weakens enough...' Boyd began to use his arms to try and rip the cloth as he was swung around. 'I don't care if I get hurt, I'm not letting Ike keep me as his pet.' At the low point of a swing Boyd managed to rip the cloth and free himself...only to be launched upwards by Ike's swing. He grasped onto his friend's arm in attempt to keep himself from flying away and wasn't noticed thankfully. 'It's only a matter of time before he notices...' Boyd looked around for any other chance at escaping. From this high in the air and this speed the only way down was a flight from a swing.
135111.title: Ike's Workout

choices: Ike heads back to his room.
1351112.content:
'I'll have to jump if--' Boyd was still in the middle of contemplating his escape when he noticed Ike's arm stop moving. He cursed and let go of the arm, only to be seized by Ike's other hand. Ike's hand opened upwards towards the sweaty giant's face as he peered down menacingly. 'And I was so close too.'

"Trying to escape, are you?" Ike spoke down to him. "And I thought I could hold you there..." Ike thought to himself for a moment as if thinking up a punishment, while pinning Boyd down with his mere fingers. "It appears you still believe you can escape."

"Ike! What's gotten into you?" Boyd called, trying to resist the pain Ike was causing him. Ike smirked evilly.

"Well Boyd...I've always wanted to be larger then you...and at the same time I've always wanted to hold someone under my control." Ike told him, "And you just happened to fill both roles I wanted." Ike pulled up on his shirt and removed it from his belt and pulled it up, revealing his abs. "How does it feel to be smaller then them?" He smirked again. Boyd's face twisted in disbelief as he began to try and wrestle Ike's fingers off of him. "Please Boyd, you're too tiny to do anything anymore." Ike laughed as he shoved Boyd unwilling into his stomach against the six pack. Being smothered against pure muscle began to pain Boyd too much to resist. "You're so weak now Boyd..." Ike acted disappointed.

'He's too strong...' Boyd inhaled deeply as he was brought away from Ike's abs. 'If I don't escape, he's just going to keep dousing me in that spice...it's an endless cycle.'

"Still want to escape Boyd...?" Ike grinned darkly again, showing he enjoyed what he just did. Boyd didn't answer before Ike dropped his shirt back down and clenched his fist, trapping him inside. The fist opened up again and he feel towards the peak of Ike's bicep and was pushed against it. "It's too cool how big my arm is compared to you..." Ike started laughing again. He dragged Boyd's body away from his arm and held him out again. "I guess that's enough fun for now..."
1351112.title: Size Exploits

choices: Boyd grows to the size of the fort.
Boyd grows to a more...extreme size.
13512.content:
"How was your training?" Ike asked, attempting to buy time.

"Pretty good." Boyd replied, "Being able to swing at a dummy helps keep me from getting rusty. Though it'd be nice to actually spare with other people since that's what keeps me in top shape..." He sounded a bit annoyed since Ike had been neglecting to spar him recently.

"We can spar tomorrow, how's that sound?" Ike chuckled. Of course, he figured Boyd would be an inch tall at that time and in his grasp.

"I'm keeping you to that." Boyd grinned back just before taking yet another large bite of the sandwich. Ike was able to hide it, but every time Boyd took a bite of the sandwich he felt an urge of excitement. "You know, it's been a while since you've actually beaten me in a spar." Ike shook his head jokingly.

"Yeah, right." He replied sarcastically. "I beat you in one of our latest matches. Remember, I managed to disarm you." Boyd simply shrugged. "Then you only win if I've been training a lot before the spar. As long as I can dodge, I win."

Boyd smirked. "Yeah, well wait until you fight me tomorrow. I've been working on you quick swordsman types. You'll be no problem." Boyd took the last bite of his sandwich and let out a content sigh. "You know, you make a pretty good sandwich. Must be in your blood." Of course, he was referring to his sister's ability to do the same. Ike was about to give a sarcastic response when he noticed an unusual look on Boyd's face.

"Something...wrong?" He asked curiously. His hand fidgeted as his excitement began to show.

"Nah...it's just...my body feels...tingly." Boyd commented. "Never felt this way before..." He stood slowly. "Maybe I just trained too hard." He began towards the kitchen when he came to a slow stop. "Ugh...now I'm feeling lightheaded..." Ike stood up.

"Here, sit back down." He urged, pulling Boyd back to his seat. "You probably just stood up too fast...." Boyd sat back down carefully and rubbed his head. "Feeling better?"

"Yeah, a bit..." Boyd replied, "Though I have to say...I think Rolf will need to let out my clothes some more. They're feeling a bit tight again." Ike gave Boyd another look and quickly realized that he did seem a bit bigger and more built than when he came in. In fact, as Ike continued to watch he could see Boyd's size slowly increasing. It was that instant Ike's joys were crushed. Lady Luck seemed to be in favor of Boyd today.
13512.title: Unbelievable Luck

151.title: Fire Emblem : Sword Of Seal

choices: A Well Hidden Rare Treasure Map!
A Shrinking Potion With An Amulet Of Invincibility!
1511.content:
Roy sighed as the folded and slid the letter from his father back into the yellow container it was brought in. Nothing had changed. His father was still sick as ever and had no doctors had been brave enough to stand up to the plate and take a shot to look at the aging ruler. Worry filled the young boy's mind. So much was going on! His father was ill, the attempt to contact Lady Lynis had failed and neither Lugh or Ray, the party's resident magic users had achieved connecting with the long gone spirit of Nils and Ninian, two powerful dragons that had once severed and helped his father. The bother and sister duo where either deceased or vanished. Roy had heard from Lord Hector, a friend of his father's, that dragon spirits do not die and fade out. When dragons die their spirits where released back to their land to wander. Sort of like a dragon heaven.

Closing his eyes, Roy wished that his friends where here to support him. Unfortunately most of the party had been sent to suppress a bandit raid in a nearby village, leaving only several people of interest, none of them who Roy wanted to see at the moment.

Closing the unusually large box Lord Eliwood had sent his message in, Roy peered out of the small window of his room, or rather his hut as the remaining members of the party had had taken residence in the small village of Napalm. He wished Marcus has here to help him on his lessons, but he too had been sent out on the attack against the bandits.

Roy's mind wandered back to the yellow box in which his father had used to carry the sole letter. Eliwood was never one to waste material, so the strange large item had confused Roy when he had opened it. Why was it so empty?

Suddenly a thought dawned on Roy. The letter probably wasn't the only thing hidden in the yellow box. There must have been something else in there, hidden away so bandits would not be able to steal and pilfer it away. Quickly the young boy once again took the lid off the box and peered inside. There was the letter and a yellow silk covering for it. And off to the side was...

Wait! What was that? Roy's keen eyes latched themselves onto a small brown string near the left hand-side. Reaching a hand him, the young lord pulled the object to reveal...
1511.title: A Strange Box

choices: Roy Decides To Have Some Fun By Tricking People, Playing Games etc.
Roy Decides That The Sexual Ways Described In The Book Would Be Much Better
15111.content:
Roy gasped. There they were. Two small purple bottles containing a mixture of various liquids and enchantments. He recognized them at once. Size potions. A special liquid made by the most powerful mages and shamans of the land. They were more typically used to shrink spies and assassins to send to the enemy in hopes they can either gather information or murder an important general. However it was more obvious why Lord Eliwood had sent these two to his son.

Roy smiled, thinking of how much his father cared for him. His father had probably read all the letters from his son saying how much he was bored and pressured and how much be wished that he could just relax and have fun for a change, like a normal child. Well the two potions were obviously going to take care of that.

Roy's boyish mind filled with wonder at all the silly things he could do with these items. Shrink himself and sneak into a general's room and secretly disturb them? Shrink someone else to the size of a toy and use them for fun? (Roy didn't realize this seemed rather cruel). Perhaps he can make himself big and boss everyone around. So many possibilities.

And then Roy's mind wandered to a recent book he had read. Experience life - sexual relaxation. General Seth had demanded he read it, saying he would have to one day grow up and have children. When Roy had protested, Seth had plainly told him that every other male in the party had already studied the book and that Roy was behind everyone.

Two choices. Roy wanted to have some fun playing games and tricking people, but if the stuff written in the novel provided by General Seth was true, then he could have a lot more fun with another male friend of his...
15111.title: What To Do?

choices: Noah - Roy needs a strong man
Zeiss - The New Dragonknight Looks Willabled
151112.content:
Roy could not keep his mind off the book. It seemed to exciting, so fresh. And if it really felt nearly as good as Seth said it did . . Roy made up his mind. He was going to try something other than is usual tricks for once. These potions were sent to him in hope that he would relax and let loose. Roy did not see himself relaxing and playing pranks while tiny. However the sexual urges he was getting as a result of his thoughts might be able to.

Hesitating before opening the bottle labeled "S" for small, Roy quickly took a small wooden toy and laid it on the floor. It was a model wagon, constructed by Wolt for placing as a form of decoration. Roy would use that thing to get around when he was much smaller.

Then, with no further thoughts, Roy undid the bottle and poured the liquid down and into his stomach.

Immediately, the changes took place. Roy felt himself becoming smaller and smaller, the world around him growing to titanic heights. His clothing was shrinking with him, so no need for embarrassment. Pretty soon a 2 inch Roy was standing in the middle of a huge room that once belonged to him. Grinning from excitement, Roy then preceded to hitch himself to the toy wagon which seemed normal size to him. He marveled at the fine details Wolt had made into the sides of the object.

However, Roy soon realized that the wagon was non-functional without someone to pull it. And since Roy was the only one small enough to do so, he couldn't attempt to pull himself. It just didn't make any sense.

Feeling disappointed that he would not be able to try out the wooden toy, Roy started walked towards the giant piece of wood that was the exit door from his place. He was going to have to find someone else. The book mentioned things that were unfamiliar to Roy. Impressive words such as "release", "sperm" and "masturbation." Roy needed to find someone who knew the book fairly well and could do the complicated process with him. But who?
151112.title: Looking For A Giant

1511121.content:
Roy decided his best bet, whether if he was going to get any help or otherwise was to approach the knight, Noah who happened to be staying not too far from him, in one of the castle's many other rooms. Noah was a strong young man, and despite with his seeming obsession with the color blue, he seemed like a reliable person. Not to mention just last battle the knight had saved his life by quickly dispatching a group of bandits when Roy was injured.

Sneaking out of his room was easy. Being only two inches tall made it easy to slip away through the door, where Roy found himself standing in the middle of a long hallway. Across from him was the door to the throne room but he knew it would be empty at this time. Instead the young Lord ran across the hall (finding it rather tiring as the distance was far greater than before) and crawled through a door's crack into a rather dim room. A long blue lance that seemed like a skyscraper told Roy he was in the right place.

From his perspective, the room was huge. A large wooden bed occupied most of the space and Roy couldn't make out much more. There was a table and rather plain looking curtains nearby. Noah however was nowhere to be found.

Sighing Roy walked over to the leg of the table and leaned against it. He was already exhausted from the long run through the hallways and wasn't sure he had the energy to go find someone else. Disappointed the young Lord sat down quietly.

Suddenly a noise could be heard and Roy lifted his head in the direction of the large wooden door he had come through not too long ago. The jiggling of the lock could be heard and Roy scrambled to his feet. Someone was coming in! Hope filled the young Lord and he quickly grabbed the table leg and wrapped his arms around it, waiting to see who would enter.
1511121.title: Anybody Home?

choices: Roy Decides To Practice On The Sleeping Giant First
1511122.content:
General Seth was already a master at the sexual ways described in the book. Roy did not want to embarrass himself by proving himself that he had no sexual experiences at all. Zeiss was obviously the better choice. The wynern was probably only recently introduced to the book as well. No worries about experience there.

Running and slipping under the small gap of the door, Roy entered the grand hallway. He was fortunate that Zeiss was placed in the room next to his. There would have been no way this would have worked if Roy had needed to run for very long in his new size.

Eying that Zeiss' door was open, Roy slipped between the crack and found himself in a darkened room. It was only dust. Zeiss should have been active. Where was he now?

Roy stood alone in the large and strange new world. Zeiss' room was a lot different than his own. To the immediate left was a table that loomed over Roy's shrunken figure. To the right, a few feet [seemed more than a few to Roy] was a nightstand, with a lone candle on top, providing the entire light source for the room.
