Robin stares at his open palm. He squints for a moment. Fear sets in as he realizes Chrom is still tiny. At their current sizes, Chrom is impossible for the tactician to spot.

Chrom looks around, trying to get his bearings. He knew he was on Robin's hand or at least that was his impression. "Robin?!" Chrom calls out as loud as he can. Looking around, Chrom quickly realizes he's on Robin's palm but is so small that he might as well be a flea. "Oh gods..." he mutters as fear begins to grip him.

"Chrom...?" Robin whispers as softly as he can fearing that he might frighten or harm Chrom otherwise.

The shrunken lord perks up when he hears Robin's voice. He looks towards where he assumes Robin's face is. "ROBIN!" He calls at the top of his lungs. He waits before trying to speak again. "Down here, by your," He pauses as he looks around. His heart drops when he realizes Robin may not even be able to hear him. "I'm too small for him to hear..." Chrom drops to his knees as he crumples over. He feels broken. There's no way for Robin to hear him, let alone know where he is.

Robin continues to squint, looking his palm over. He clung to some hope that he would locate Chrom. He knew he had to. Though right now he wished one of the other Shepherds was nearby to help them. After a few moments of squinting and staring, Robin thinks he sees something on his palm.
155212121112222222212212.title: Even bigger of a problem

choices: Robin is determined to get at least one of them back to normal
Robin agrees, Chrom lives forever within Robin
1552121211122222222122121.content:
Robin sees the faintest hint of a blue tuff of hair. His hope rises as he takes a closer look. Chrom. He was relieved to find the tiny lord. It was too dangerous though to leave Chrom on his palm where so many things could happen. Very carefully, Robin brings his hand up to his mouth.

Chrom sits upright when he feels movement. He looks around frantically. "What is---" before Chrom could finish, the movement stopped. "Robin?" Chrom murmurs, knowing full well the tactician can't hear him. He sees the tongue descend toward him and is pulled into Robin's mouth. Chrom shudders slightly as he sees how tiny he is compared to the tastebuds on the tongue. "He probably doesn't even know I'm here." Chrom says as he looks around. His entire body sinks into a single tastebud, only furthering Chrom's nervousness. He feels everything shift as he tumbles back towards the awaiting throat. He easily slide inside and tumbled down the long tube.

Robin sits back, hoping to feel or hear something. So far he could only feel Chrom for a split second on his tongue. After waiting a bit, he figured Chrom was in his stomach, safe and sound. "Chrom...?" He whispers.

Meanwhile inside...
Chrom lands in the stomach and quickly leaps to his feet. He hears Robin whisper his name. "Robin!" He calls out. He then hears the tactician breathe a sigh of relief.

"Thank the gods." Robin whispers. There's a bit of a pause before either speak.

"Wait... did you swallow me in hopes of being able to hear me?" Chrom asks.

"That's part of it. I vaguely saw you on my palm and knew it wasn't safe to leave you there. Guess so long as you're somewhere where your voice can echo a little to magnify the sound, I can hear you. Albeit barely." Robin says as he puts his hand to this gut. "I don't know what we can really do about things now. If I let you out---"

"I'm too tiny to be noticed." Chrom replace as he rubs one of the walls of the stomach. Neither say anything but both know what the other is thinking. "Robin, I can't see any other options aside from where things are now. At least it's safe and warm in here. Plus it feels like I'm just getting a great big hug from you. I don't mind living in here." He says.

Robin thinks for a moment.
1552121211122222222122121.title: Finds Chrom

15521212111222222221221212.content:
Robin nods numbly in response to Chrom. "I hate to admit it, but I can't think of any other options either." He mumbles.

Chrom gives a half hearted sigh as he makes himself comfortable within the stomach. High above he hears the powerful thumping of Robin's heartbeat. He smiles as he listens to the sounds all around him. The heartbeat. The lungs filling with air then expelling it. Despite how hopeless things seemed, Chrom knew Robin would take care of him. Even if he could never leave the tactician's stomach.

Robin stood, the ground around him quaking as he did so. He decided against returning to the Shepherds' camp and instead went deeper into the forest. While he couldn't feel any of Chrom's movements anymore, he knew the tiny lord would be safe inside him.

It took the two a couple of days to get a system down when it came to eating. Robin had to chew everything until it was a very fine paste. And Chrom got used to such. He didn't enjoy the meals half the time but knew this was how things were to be from now on. Every few days, Robin would recast the protection spell on Chrom.

Several years had passed with them living like such. Both content with being with one another on such a deep level. "Happy anniversary, Chrom." Robin says softly while he watches the stars.

Chrom nuzzles the stomach wall. "Happy anniversary to you too, Robin." He replies as he tucks himself in for the night. "Hey, how many years has it been?"

Robin chuckles slightly. "Tired of me already?" He jokes as he leans back on his elbows. "Five years now. Five years since we admired our feelings for one another."

Chrom yawns. "Seems like just yesterday we were fighting and carrying the weight of the world. Didn't even realize I'd been tiny and in you for five years."

"Yeah, hard to believe sometimes. But I'm glad we're together."

"I'm glad too. I can't even think of anyone else who'd be so dedicated. I mean, you cast that spell on me every few days. I figured eventually you'd get tired of doing such and just let your innards do what comes natural." Chrom admits. He was genuinely surprised that Robin had been so deidcates to keeping him safe for all this time. Had their roles been reversed, Chrom wasn't sure he could be as dedicated.

Robin chuckles slightly. "I don't mind. I told you before, I'd protect you no matter what. I'd never let anything more happen to you." He says. He paused thinking for a moment. "You know I'd never digest you."

"I know. But this isn't fair to you. Having to cater to me and carry me around like this. I'm just a burden, a parasite."

"I don't see you as such. You're never a burden. We've been together for five years. I'd do anything to make it longer. I want to grow old with you, Chrom. Living like this, I'm fine with it. So long as your safe and fine with things, I'm happy."

Chrom smiles, he blushes a bit. He rubs the stomach walls to show how much he loves his tactician. Deep down he knows Robin won't feel it but he rubs anyway. "I love you, Robin."

Robin smiles as he finally lays back. "I love you too, Chrom."
15521212111222222221221212.title: As close to a happy ending as they can

choices: One of the other Shepherds standing over him
15521212111222222221222.content:
“Oh no...” was all Robin could mutter as he realized everything around him was looking bigger. He was shrinking and fast too. Once everything was done, he gauged he was maybe two inches in height.

“What’s oh no?!” Chrom calls.

Robin glances at his stomach, realizing Chrom must’ve shrunk too. “We’ve got a bit of a problem... I... uh... shrunk...” he says, trying his hardest to stay calm.

“WHAT?!” Chrom yells in fear.

The tactician sighs as he looks around. “Don’t worry, I’ll figure this out.” He says as he starts walking. He knew the way back to camp, it was just a bit of a walk. Thankfully he still had his Elfire and Arcwind tomes should something happen.

After a few hours, Robin stopped to catch his breath. He studied the area and gauged he still had a long ways to go. As he’s catching his breath, it suddenly gets dark. Looking up Robin sees...
15521212111222222221222.title: Robin shrinks

choices: One of the mounted/armor units (Frederick, Stahl, Kellam)
155212121112222222212221.content:
Robin sighs when he sees it’s a friend. He frantically starts trying to get their attention though.

Who is it?

Who’s that sword unit?
155212121112222222212221211.title: Sword

choices: Help but toys with Robin and Chrom
1552121211122222222122212111.content:
“Gaius! Gaius down here!” Robin calls.

The thief pauses what he was doing and looks around. He heard his name, he recognized the voice. Glancing down he sees a tuft of silver accompanied by a black longcoat. He squats to get a better look, his eyes never revealing what he’s thinking. “Bubbles...?” He questions as he picks up the tiny tactician.

“Yeah, it’s me. I got hit by a spell from Validar and next thing I knew, poof, I’m tiny.” Robin explains.

Gaius stares for a moment. “And Blue? I know the two of you were to have a strategy meeting today.” He says slowly.

Robin grumbles slightly but fills Gaius in on everything from Chrom shrinking to present. He left out the details about his and Chrom’s alone time.

Gaius nods slowly. “Seems like you and Blue are in quite the pickle.” He says while rubbing his chin. “Alright, I’ll...”
1552121211122222222122212111.title: Gaius

15521212111222222222.content:
Robin staggers from the power of Validar’s spell. He counters with a Thoron, hitting Validar in the chest, to his horror though the sorcerer seems unaffected. “Looks like you’re all out.” Validar says as the Thoron tome’s last page dissolves.

Taking a step back, Robin tries to come up with a plan. He didn’t have any other tomes with him, and would need to get close if he was going to use his Brave Sword. Getting in close was the problem. He barely managed to dodge the next rush of dark magic. His body already felt weak, if he kept this battle up for too much longer he would be defeated.

A series of spells hit Robin, bringing him to his knees. It hurt to breath, blood stained his vision. He heard Validar laugh as the sorcerer readied one more spell. “You’ve gone soft being around Ylissens. Don’t worry, once we’re through here, you’ll come back to your senses.” Validar stated as he fires another blitz of dark magic.

The tactician’s vision blurs. His ears ring for a bit. Everything soon goes dark as he collapses. Validar wake over and inspects his handy work. “There’s is no damage that can’t be fixed. Grima will restore you.” He says as he drags the tactician off.

A few days later, Robin wakes, finding himself...
15521212111222222222.title: Validar wins

choices: Validar is forceful and knocks Robin out again
155212121112222222221.content:
Confused, Robin looks around and finds himself in a bedroom. It’s simple in layout, a bed, desk with a chair, bookshelf and some drawers. Slowly he sits up, rubbing his head as he does so; memories of recent events come flooding back as he does so. His hand presses against his stomach, recalling that at last he knew Chrom was inside. “Chrom...?” He questions slowly, fear starting to set in.

“Robin...?” Chrom replies, his voice sounds fatigued and very weak.

“How bad of shape are you in, Chrom?” The tactician asks as he looks around.

It takes a moment before Chrom replies. “Still in one piece but so hungry and thirsty...” Chrom responds.

Nodding to himself, Robin stands and walks to the door. He puts a hand on the handle and tests it. Locked. He glanced towards the windows, figuring it was safe to assume they were also locked. As he looks around the room he notices a tray on the desk. Cautiously he approaches and examines the tray and the food upon it. There’s no way of knowing whether it was poisoned or not but at this point it was hard to care, both he and Chrom were hungry. He eats the roll, fruit and bear jerky that were on the tray then glances about the room again.

Robin’s attention is drawn to the door when he hears it creek open. In steps none other than Validar.
155212121112222222221.title: In a bedroom

choices: The Shepherds managed to save the day
1552121211122222222211.content:
Robin is instantly on edge and ready to fight unarmed if it comes to it. Validar closes the door then holds up a hand, palm outward. “Calm yourself, my child.” Validar says as he indicates his lack of weapons. “Neither of us is armed.” He adds.

“What do you want?” Robin growls, getting right to the point. He feels Chrom shift a bit, burrowing against part of his stomach he assumed.

“It’s clear to me that you don’t have any memory of life prior to those Ylisseans.” Validar says as he walks over to the bookshelf and pulls down a photo album. “Perhaps this will help you remember.” He adds as he sits on the bed and signals for Robin to sit next to him.

Robin hesitates, but eventually walks over and sits. He stays silent as Validar goes through the photo album and talks about each picture. Every so often, Robin feels a throbbing in his head as some of his memories come back to him.

Validar indicates a specific picture. “This was from the day you learned you were going to be Grima’s vessel. You were so excited and happy. I had spent months explaining everything to you and you tried your hardest to become strong enough.”

Robin feels the brand in his hand start burning. His head hurt more than any other time. The memory came flooding back. He remembered the excitement he felt, the days that turned to months of training. But mostly he remembered the pride he felt knowing he had been chosen for greatness. “No.” He says as he shakes his head. “I’ll never become that monster.” He says as he stands.

Validar shakes his head. “I had hoped you would come to your senses, but I guess not.” He adds before setting the photo album aside. Both hear the door click open and Robin is struck with a powerful dark spell, collapsing instantly. Validar caught the tactician before he hit the ground. “Was that needed?” He asked the silver haired woman who stood in the doorway.

Sometime later Robin awoke to the smell of blood. He looked around as saw that he had been taken to the Dragon’s Table, the altar for Grima. He tries to move, to struggle, only to find he had been fully restrained. He faintly feels Chrom frantically moving around inside his stomach. “Sorry I was too weak to protect you Chrom.” He thinks as he starts to accept his fate.
1552121211122222222211.title: Validar comes to talk

1552121212.content: Chrom can’t wait. He begins exploring Robin’s sleeping form. He walks along until he reaches the tactician’s neck. Glancing around he tries to decide if he wanted to venture to Robin’s face or go under the shirt and continue lower.
1552121212.title: Explore Robin's form

choices: Chrom somehow gets Robin’s attention/Robin feels something in his stomach
15521212121.content:
Chrom decides to go toward Robin’s face. He walks along until he reaches the tactician’s chin. It takes some work but he soon climbs up and looks ahead of him. Robin was still sleeping soundly but with his occasional snoring, his mouth would hang open for a moment or two.

Despite any bit of reasoning, Chrom crawls towards Robin’s mouth and slides a hand along the lips. He watches a the tactician’s lips part a little more. Cautiously and against any bit of better judgment, Chrom climbs into Robin’s mouth. He walks about for a bit, exploring his best friend’s mouth. As he explores he feels movement around him and soon falls into the awaiting throat. He struggles but it only aids the muscles dragging him down toward the tactician’s stomach.

Chrom lands with a plop in the tactican’s stomach, fear finally setting in. “Oh gods.” Chrom begins and he looks around. Robin had no clue that the shrunken lord was in his stomach, nor how much danger Chrom was in. “ROBIN! Robin wake up!” Chrom calls in a panic.

Meanwhile...
Robin yawns as he starts waking up. He feels along his chest where he had left Chrom. “Chrom...?” He questions when he can’t find the shrunken blue haired lord. He sits up and looks around, fear settling in. “Chrom?” He calls out as he looks around.

His stomach rumbles slightly in agitation, reminding him that he was hungry. Robin rubs his belly slightly but ignores the yawning hunger as he searches for his best friend.
15521212121.title: To the face

choices: Robin throws up (getting Chrom out, fast)
Robin can’t throw up (Chrom gets an inside tour of his tactician)
155212121211.content:
Chrom is punching, kicking and screaming; anything to get Robin’s attention. He curses at his desire to explore not even thinking about the dangers that could and very likely will happen. Around him, Chrom feels the stomach contract and churn as it continues to grumble for food. “ROBIN!” Chrom calls as loud as he can.

Meanwhile...
Robin’s hand goes to his gut as he feels incredible pain. “What did I eat yesterday?” He mutters as he clutched his gut. He feels constant moving of something in his stomach and curses at the pain. A light goes off in his head as his eyes looks at his gut. “Wait...” he mumbles as he tries to think. He tries to focus on the movement for a bit, each one feeling foreign to how his stomach usually felt when he ate bad food. Realization dawned on him. Chrom was missing. And suddenly his stomach hurt. Quickly, the tactician mutters a spell to try to protect Chrom from any further harm. “Chrom! Chrom, calm down a moment.” He says.

Inside the stomach...
Chrom is tiring out. His arms and legs are sore. On the verge of giving up Chrom feels his body spasm as a blue light shrouds him. He looks around and sighs when he hears Robin’s voice.

“Robin!” He calls out.

“Chrom, are you alright?” Robin asks as he keeps a hand against his stomach.

“Yeah, for the time being anyway.” Chrom responds.

“Don’t worry, I’ll get you out.” Robin says trying to calm the shrunken lord.
155212121211.title: Getting Robin’s attention

155212122.content:
Robin yawns tiredly as his eyes flutter open. He looks down towards his chest and sees Chrom is still sound asleep. A small grin forms on his face as he carefully picks Chrom up. He looks at the blue haired lord in the palm of his hand and chuckles slightly as he sits up, making sure not to disturb Chrom. "Chrom... wake up, Chrom." He says in as calmly a voice as he can manage.

The lord stirs slightly but remains asleep. Robin shakes his head before trying to figure out what to do. He could wake Chrom or leave him to snooze a bit longer. After a moment, Robin made a choice.
155212122.title: Robin wakes first

choices: Robin shrugs and continues to town
1552121222.content:
Robin moves slowly making sure he doesn't disturb his shrunken friend but slides off his bed. He held Chrom's sleeping form in his palm and looked around his room. Where could he leave the tiny lord where he would be comfy and not at risk of being crushed? He glanced at his bed, sure it was comfy but if anyone came in while Robin was out, a lot of things could happen to Chrom. His desk wasn't comfortable no matter what he did.

A light went off in the tactician head as he glanced down at Chrom. He thought of a place he could put Chrom, and be able to ensure his safety. Chrom would hate it but Robin had already made up his mind. Carefully he slides Chrom into his mouth and closes once he was sure the lord was clear of his teeth. He felt Chrom roll over on his tongue and even snuggle into it. Sure it wasn't the most logical of places but it ensured Robin could keep Chrom safe and knew his whereabouts. Plus he couldn't argue with how good Chrom taste.

The tactician walks over to his desk and begins thumbing through books again. After a solid hour of reading with no results of anything regarding shrinking, he decides to head into town. As he's walking he over hears some of the other Shepherds talking and commenting about Chrom's recent disappearance. Some were worried, like Frederick, Lissa, and those that had been Shepherds longer than Robin, some seemed indifferent. Frederick was talking about mounting a search of the surrounding area. He assigned each Shepherd to an area and the search began.

Robin was thankful he hadn't been noticed and could easily continue to town. Or so he thought. Turned out someone had noticed him and also noticed he was calm about Chrom's disappearance. After a bit of walking Robin heard someone behind, he quickly spun around only to end up face to face with Gaius, a thief that they had recruited.

"Morning Bubbles, you were awfully calm at Frederick's little meet earlier." Gaius says as he calmly follows Robin. The tactician shrugged, he still had Chrom in his mouth and didn't want to speak due to such. "So heading into town? Know something we don't?" Gaius paused. He knew he was right, Robin always knew something that no one else did. "So where's Blue?"

Robin stopped in his tracks. He couldn't believe Gaius had figured him out so quickly. He looked at Gaius, trying to read the thief's body language. He was calm, almost to an eerie degree. It made Robin uncomfortable.

"Bubbles, where is Blue?" Gaius asked again.
1552121222.title: Let Chrom rest

15521212222.content:
While he trusted Gaius, Robin wasn't comfortable explaining the situation. He shrugged then began walking towards the town. Gaius smirked and followed behind the tactician, determined to get an answer. "Had a war council with Blue and need a strategy book?" He asked as he walked behind Robin.

Robin rolled his eyes and continued walking. He felt Chrom shift slightly on his tongue, he would've moaned in delight but knew such would catch Gaius' attention. Chrom shifted again, this time moving closer to Robin's throat. The tactician tried keeping his cool as he moved his tongue to reposition Chrom.

"Bubbles, wait." Gaius said as he grabbed Robin's arm stopping him. His eyes were intense, something that was unusual for the thief. Robin reached down slowly grabbing his tome. Gaius had his steel sword drawn and ready.

Ahead of them were some bandits. Nothing they couldn't handle. But the situation made Robin very uneasy. Gaius watched and waited. His cool temperament showing through. The bandits rushed the two, determined to steal anything of value. Robin hurled a fireball forward taking out the first. Gaius blocked a sword strike before countering with his own. During the combat, one bandit had managed to sneak up on Robin and knocked him to the ground. He felt a lump in his throat, coughing several times trying force the obstruction out. Nothing, the obstruction was still present. Robin mental kicked himself as he was forced to swallow to clear his throat. "Gaius, on your left!" He called as he got to his feet.

Gaius easily dodged and took out the bandit. Only the one that knocked Robin to the ground remained. He took a step back clearly rethinking this. Robin launched a fireball at him but he easily evaded. He lunged forward, his axe aimed for the tactician's chest. Robin moved to avoid but was still grazed along the his left arm. He winced slightly before hurling another fireball. The bandit was hit but still standing. There was clear hesitation in his eyes. Before he could make a move though, he felt a sharpness across his abdomen. Gaius pulled his blade back before wiping it off.

"That's all of them." The thief said as he turned to the tactician.

Robin nodded as he tore his sleeve off and tied it around the wound on his arm. He winced slightly from the pain. He paused as he moved his tongue around his mouth and didn't feel his passenger. "Chrom!" His thoughts instantly drifted to when he swallowed. His eyes looked down at his gut as he moved his left hand to it. He felt movement inside, at the least he knew Chrom was alive but for how long?!

"Bubbles?" Gaius asked, a faint hint of worry in his voice.

Meanwhile...
Chrom had woken up to being jostled about but it was pitch black. He couldn't see anything. Then he felt it. He was flung backwards and was pulled down a slimy tube. He landed with a wet plop and quickly figured out where he was. "Who ate me?!" He yelled in panic as he tried to move to one side. He heard voices, one sounded like Robin's voice, it was the more clear of the two voices. The other while muffled, sounded like the orange haired thief. "Robin!" Chrom shouted as loud as he could.

"Chrom! Are you alright?" Robin responds, his voice panicked.

"Yeah, mind telling me why you ate me?" Chrom questions. He's surprised there's no acids but is thankful nonetheless.

Robin sighs in relief. "It's a long story." He starts but fills Chrom in completely.

Chrom nods and sits back against the stomach wall. "Well... while I disagree with where you put me, I'm unharmed. And looks like it's staying such for now."

Robin murmurs a spell to himself. A blue light envelops the lord before vanishing. "There. You should be safer now."

"So let me get this straight. Blue shrunk somehow, you were going into town to find some books about such then all this?" Gaius asks. Robin nods. "Well, I'll help ya both out, I guess."
15521212222.title: Robin Continues to town

Gaius eyed the pie hungrily. Man he wanted a piece, but he already had like three pies and two chocolates earlier today. Still, there was no reason he couldn't have another right? Smirking he took the pie from Stahl. "You sure you don't want a piece yourself?"

"No thats ok! I already ate today. But..." Stahl bit his lips. He also loved to eat. Maybe he could just try a piece. It was no big deal right?

"Come on!" Gaius took out a set of forks, digging one into the pie before handing the other to Stahl. "Try a piece!"

The two men gathered around the baked treat and started stuffing their face. After just a taste both of them looked extremely satisfied.

"Wow that was so good!" Stahl licked his lips. The pie was incredible.

"Yeah I agree." Gaius stuffed another mouthful inside. But wait, he was feeling oddly strange for some reason.

1553111.content:
Corrin couldn’t help but smile to himself as he relaxed in the hot springs of his private realm. He was alone, he knew this wouldn’t last as one of his allies would inevitably wander in, he just hoped that it would be one of his more muscular companions. The thought of seeing them wearing nothing but a loose fitting towel, or nothing in some cases, filled him with a tension he felt that he needed to release. Little did he know he would be getting well acquainted with these men very shortly. As he opened his eyes to burst of light and energy that knocked him unconscious.

Corrin awoke afterwards to discover himself floating in what appeared to be an ocean. He’d quickly discover that he was still in the hot springs as he saw a giant shadow appear over him. He was surprised when he saw that it was...

Kaden- Corrin had no idea how far he was away from the edge when he sees the naked butt of the fox spirit Kaden appeared above him. Having lost his towel in the jump, Kaden lands in the water on top of Corrin, trapping the shrunken Royal between his cheeks.

15531113.title: More Choices

choices: Takumi wakes up...the size of a toy
1553112.content:
Takumi sighed and set his bow down. There wasn't a lot going on today. Despite being in the middle of a war the team still had days of just waiting around. Today was one of those days. Ryoma had set out early with Kaze and Setsuna to meet with a nearby tribe while Corrin and Azura were shopping for new weapons. That left a handful of people to watch their base, one of them being Takumi himself.

In his hands was a pendant. Azura had found it in the forests and had given it to him as a present. Many of the others had trinkets and accessories, so Takumi decided it was just too rude to leave his off any longer. Looking down he examined the strange gem on the necklace. It was probably magical. Who knows

Takumi slipped the pendant around his neck and turned to head back to camp. The deer and boars of the woods weren't interested in playing the hunting game today. He might have better luck rummaging through camp to see what he could find, maybe help Jakob with his tasks.

As he began walking back to camp he felt a strange sensation. Suddenly a glowing light radiated out from the pendant and surrounded his body. Takumi was startled and jumped slightly, "H-Hey! What the!" The light engulfed him within moments and he felt his vision go dark. Oh no, was this wicked magic? Before he could call for help Takumi collapsed into the grass, just moments away from camp.
1553112.title: Takumi

choices: It was Ryoma looking for Takumi
It was Leo, who actually cast the spell!
15531121.content:
As his eyes opened Takumi found his body aching. Groaning he pulled himself up, rubbing his head. What the heck had happened? Evil magic had struck him, that was for sure but he couldn't piece out much else. As he managed to get on his feet however he noticed something strange. The grass around him were huge! They went up all the way to his waist, and it seemed like a forest.

A glow radiated from his hands as he began to read the sacred texts within. The magic filled his veins Boey found himself struggling to keep up. His own tent was quickly illuminated with brightness as the spell overtook the small space. Maybe he should have done this outside?

The magic seemingly surrounded his body and Boey feared for the worst. But then, suddenly as it came, the light disappeared. The tome fell to the ground and Boey groaned, feeling his body ache with exhaustion. What the hell was this time? And what was the spell? Nothing had happened and he felt drained of all energy.

With that his vision went blank and the young mage found himself falling backwards as he blacked out.
15532233.title: Boey's Experiments

choices: Conrad decides to help by taking Boey with him...
Boey snaps at Conrad, making him frustrated
Conrad has a dirty fetish for tiny men...
155322333.content:
Boey rubbed his eyes. God! What had happened? He could near noises nearby and he recognized the voice of Conrad. Thankfully it seemed like he had been found when he had blacked out.

Opening his eyes Boey looked upwards. His vision met the concerned looking face of Conrad who was staring down at him. Only Conrad's face filled his entire vision. It seemed massive! Boey was startled, but he thought maybe he was just confused. Rubbing his eyes again he squinted.

No wait...Conrad's face was indeed massive. And that wasn't the only thing. Looking around realization dawned on him. Somehow he had shrunk! In a panic he scrambled around, looking in horror and shock at the massive environment around him. He must have been no bigger than a mere toy! Underneath him was some kind of soft fabric and bedding. The entire situation was too much for the young mage. What the hell had happened?!

"Woah! Relax!" Up above Conrad stared at him with a concerned face. Boey however couldn't heed the advice. He looked up at the massive titan looming over him and snapped back. "Relax? How am I supposed to relax when you're a giant and I'm the size of a toy?! Get me my tome! Quick!"

The tiny mage was panting at the state he had worked himself into. He had to reverse this spell - and fast!

"Your tome?" Conrad looked down confused at his miniature ally and then scanned the ground around him. "I don't see it...in fact I just found you like this, lying there." The white knight looked confused, but he was worried about Boey. What was he going to do?
155322333.title: Found by Conrad

155323.content:
Fire Emblem Warriors where Prince Rowan, Princess Lianna (doubt we’ll see her), and Darios attempt to restore the Shield of Flames to seal away the Chaos Dragon.

Alright, who do we want to start with?
155323.title: Fire Emblem Warriors (Mix)

1553231.content:
Who’s going to grow or shrink?

Rowan is brash, headstrong and wants to be a knight. While Darios is calm, level headed and acts like a guiding character.
1553231.title: Rowan or Darios

15532311.content:
Prince Rowan it is! But will he grow or shrink? Let’s find out!
——-

“Thank you for saving me. Please take this as a token of my gratitude.” A curate stated as he dropped a tonic of sorts before leaving.

“Wait! What does this do?!” Rowan called as he looked it over. It wasn’t blue, yellow or green. No, it was purple.

“Use it only in a time of dire need.” was all the Curate said before he left the battlefield.

“Rowan! Move!” Chrom yelled from across the battlefield.

“Huh? Ah!” Rowan looked up in time to see the Sky Knight’s lance coming at him. He felt someone shove him out of harm’s way. As he looks over he sees the tactician take the lance through his right hand. “Robin!”

“I’m fine!” Robin calls as he blasts the Sky Knight with a Thoron spell. He winces but fights on, protecting Rowan from the Sky Knight. After the enemy was dispatched, Robin turned to look to Rowan. “Are you alright, Rowan?” He asks as he walks over, his hand bleeding.

“I’m alright. But your hand—-“

“I’ll be fine.” Robin replies as he pours some Vulnerary onto the wound. He looks at the tonic that Rowan was given. “What’s that?”

“I don’t know. Some tonic that the Curate gave me for saving him.” Rowan replied.

From across the battlefield they hear Chrom, Frederick, and Takumi fighting on. “Come on, we need to help them!” Robin says as he begins to head to the sounds of combat.

“Wait, maybe this tonic can help us. He said to use it a dire time.” Rowan says before uncorking the bottle. He chugs down the tonic then rushes after Robin. He feels dizzy as he runs after the tactician. “Hey, Robin! Wait up... I don’t feel so good.”

Robin turns to look, his eyes go wide. “Rowan you’re...”
15532311.title: Rowan

choices: Palm, wants to know what’s going on
155323112.content:
“Rowan, you’re shrinking!” Robin calls as he rushes to the tiny Rowan.

The blonde lord looks around, panicked as he realizes he’s only a three inches tall. “What?! Why would he give me something like this?!” He questions. Everything gets dark around him sending a wave of fear through him. “Wha—-“

“Relax, it’s only me.” Robin says as he gently picks Rowan up with his wounded right hand. “This is going to make things tricky.” He murmurs as he brings Rowan up to eye level.

“Don’t worry about me, go help the others.” Rowan says as he stands on Robin’s palm. He made sure to avoid stepping on the wound.

“Right...” Robin replies as he slides Rowan into the inner chest pocket of his coat. He rushes toward the combat that was on going, casting his Thoron at any enemies that got in his way. “Chrom, Frederick, Takumi!” He called as he reached them.

“Where’s Rowan?!” Chrom hollers over in worry.

“He’s... he’s fine...” Robin responds as he uses an Elfire to clear a path.

Once all the enemies had been dispatched and the group had a moment to breathe, Robin filled them in on what happened. He carefully removed Rowan from his coat pocket, letting the shrunken lord sit on the palm of his right hand.

“How did this happen?” Chrom asks as he looks Rowan over.

“I used a tonic that the Curate gave me. He said to use it only in a time of dire need. But why he gave me a hexed tonic, I’m not sure.” The blonde prince replied.

“Sounds like a Nohrian trick.” Takumi chimes in as he looks around.

“Regardless of Nohrian trick or bad batch of potion, we should meet up with Princess Lianna and her group. Perhaps they’ve encountered a similar problem or know someone who might know how to reverse this.” Frederick states.

“And what am I supposed to do?” Rowan questions.

“Don’t worry, I’ve got ya.” Robin says.

“You’re in good hands, Rowan. Robin won’t let you down.” Chrom adds before he looks towards the meeting point. “Let’s get a move on.”

Robin looks to Rowan, he sees the fear and worry in the prince’s eyes. “Hey,” The tactician begins. Rowan looks up, his pale blue eyes meeting the tactician’s deep brown eyes. “Don’t worry, I’ll keep you safe.” Robin says, his voice sincere. Rowan nods numbly as he sits on the open palm. “Would you prefer to stay on my palm or ride in my coat pocket?” Robin asks.
155323112.title: Shrinking, Tiny Rowan

choices: Only Darios, Owain, Leo and Niles arrive
1553231122.content:
“I’d rather stay where I can be aware of everything going on.” Rowan says as he sits on Robin’s palm.

“Alright, best hang on.” Robin replies as he runs behind Chrom, Frederick and Takumi.

The group arrives at the meeting spot and wait. “We’re a little early.” Frederick says as he ties his horse’s reigns to a nearby tree.

Robin sits on a fallen log, he sets Rowan on his lap before tear part of his sleeve off. He winces as he bandages his wounded hand. “You sure you’re going to be alright?” Rowan asks as he watches Robin. He sees the tactician give a faint smile then nod. “Thank you for protecting me back there.” He added as he fidgets slightly while sitting on the tactician’s lap.

“Don’t worry about it, Rowan.” Robin says as he leans back.

“There they are!” Chrom calls as he sees the other group approach. “Looks like they’ve added a few new faces.” He adds while watching.
1553231122.title: Open Palm

15532311222.content:
Had a few thoughts before writing this chapter. Warning this is a short chapter as it branches again.

——
Darios approached Chrom, Frederick and the the others, a look of concern on his face when he didn’t see Rowan right away. “Where’s Rowan?!” He asks a faint hint of worry lining his voice.

Robin looks over, his gaze narrows slightly. “First off, where’re Lianna, Lissa, and Cordelia?” He responds.
——
Is Owain going to be with Darios?
For now assume Leo and Niles are.
15532311222.title: Only a few from the group arrive

155323112222.content:
“And Owain for that matter?” Robin adds.

Darios looks down, a look of shame on his expression. “We got separated on our way here. I figured they would’ve come straight here. Camilla and Elise with them, I was certain.” He says.

“And who are—-“ Chrom begins, trying to keep a level head.

“Nohrian scum!” Takumi is quick to draw his bow. An energy arrow materializing as he aims at Leo.

The horseback mage instantly has his tome at the ready. His gaze narrowing. His retainer draws his bow and has it aimed right at Takumi. “You’ll die before you ever lay an attack upon Lord Leo.” Niles growls sharply.

“Whoa there. Let’s not get too hasty.” Robin cuts in as he stands between the three men. He had repositioned Rowan to be in his coat pocket, out of harm’s way.

“Before anything else is done, where is Rowan?” Darios questions. Chrom lets out a low breath before filling Darios in. There’s a clear expression upon the Gristone prince’s face. One that not many of the party catch. “May I, see him? I must know he’s alright.” Darios says.

Chrom turns to Robin and nods, clearly missing the expression Darios wore.
155323112222.title: No, Owain is also missing

1553232.content: The newest game with a whole bunch of new characters to enjoy. So, who'll be shrinking?
1553232.title: Fire Emblem Three Houses

15532321.content: The Ashen Demon is about to experience a change in perspective.
15532321.title: Byleth

155323211.content:
Pre Timeskip

Byleth quietly sighed to himself as he put away his teaching materials, happy that another day of lessons was over. Usually, he would head to his dorm to get some shut-eye, but he had other plans for tonight. After meeting with several of his students to help them improve personally, he decided to do something besides sleeping his evening away. As he left his classroom, he thought about how much progress all of his students made, and his mind drifted to his male ones. He shook these thoughts away, ‘I can’t think of them like that, they’re my students. Maybe after they graduate, but I shouldn’t do that now.’

After dropping off his belongings and getting a quick drink from the dining hall, he went towards the meeting place to set up ...

A Tea Party: After putting down all of the food and getting the tea ready, Byleth shrinks while hanging over the table. Dropping from the sky, he lands in one of the filled teacups disoriented from the high fall. Coming back to the surface, he discovered the cup looked more like a pool from his perspective. After swimming over to the sloped edge, he began to climb out, only to hear the voice of one or more students that had discovered his delectable display of pastries and hot tea.

The Sauna: After taking a seat in the sauna, Byleth collapses, waking up an unknown amount of time later tiny and naked on the bench. As he tries to figure out a way down, he hears the door open and sees one or more students enter. Byleth is shocked by their new massive size, but he must still get their attention and hope that they don’t sit on him in the process. Of course, he might discover that now is the time to do some exploring of his own.
155323211.title: Slot 1
